text: Free spring rolls on the house she said as she sat them on the table.  Very friendly staff an I feel welcome even as a single diner.  I ordered the cashew chicken mild you have the option of getting it spicy spicy if you chose.  Well they brought out catfish instead of chicken.  I tried it wasn't bad but I would not be the person to order fish.  Another waitress noticed it was wrong an went an re-ordered the chicken for me.  I would suggest maybe pointing to the menu when you order.  Cashew chicken arrived undercooked veggies maybe they rushed it after getting the wrong order the first time. She didn't bring any plates so I could eat on this time.  Clearly she is mad because of the wrong order.  Kind of an attitude when she brought the chicken out.  Asked for a Togo box I can go home an finish cooking it.  Very disappointed in my first time here.  At home now finishing the cooking myself.

First visit to Thai Cuisine (interesting name, no?) and first visit to Pittsburgh, so that should set up this review nicely. Context is, of course, that I expected very little from this town, yet I've been completely surprised. #1 - faux meat on a menu is a huge plus for me, I just love it, and I don't care to hear comments like "if you are a vegetarian, why would you eat something that is meant to taste and look like meat?" Shut up. I just like it. #2 - the prices are so cheap. I only looked at the vegetarian menu where every entree is about $10 for dinner, and while that's no steal nor does it compare to Thai food prices in Thailand, it's decent. #3 - cutest. waitress. ever. AND she mentioned that "all of my cool friends have read that book" which, by default, makes me a cool kid? Hmmm. Maybe. Then again, maybe not.

Ever since they've opened, I've been a regular here. In the past year I haven't been able to come as often because I moved to the other side of the city, but still dine occasionally and take out since my parents' house is close by. I'm writing this review because my last visit was not as pleasant. My boyfriend and I were craving thai food and since we were going to this side of town, I suggested and was excited to eat here. The Pad See Ewe is my favorite dish and I ALWAYS order it. This time the vegetables tasted burnt, noodles were overcooked, and the dish overall was a little bland. It was the very first time I've ever complained about a dish here. Since I also work in the restaurant industry, I like to avoid making employees feel uncomfortable by complaining, but I just didn't want to pay for something I wasn't going to eat. I asked the server to take the dish back in the nicest way possible. Then the owner comes out a couple minutes later saying they tasted it in the back and there's nothing wrong with the dish. We explained we're regulars and it usually tastes amazing and it wasn't the same this time, but she went on to say there's nothing wrong with the dish (basically called us liars) and told us if we don't like it, not to order it next time.. The worst part was when I told her I was a regular, she said she recognizes me but still decided to treat us the way she did. This experience was so disappointing only because I used to love coming here and I actually admired the owner because she was always so nice and hardworking. I decided to give 3 stars because I figured it wouldn't be fair to give them just 1 since I've enjoyed so much of their food until now. Their food is delicious (most of the time). I just want to warn you not to complain about the food unless you're ready to be treated like a criminal. I really hope that they change the way they handle complaints.

This is my second favorite Thai Restaurant in Las Vegas. Everything on the menu is so good that you can close your eyes and point, and you cannot go wrong. If you enjoy the traditional Thai dishes done right, then this is the place for you! The staff is fun, friendly and so attentive. I always look forward to coming back here!
SO delicious and such a beautiful restaurant. And BYOB! Loved the pulled pork buns and the spicy noodle. Yum yum

Very much just a small great place to eat.  Everything I've had here is great and I try new things all the time.  My wife loves the Pad Se Ew with extra chinese broccolli  and the vegetable rolls.  The Tom Kha Kai is the creamiest that you'll ever find, Red Curry, Spicy Beef Salad, Silver Noodle Salad, Rad Na, Papaya Salad, Thai Beef Jerky, Curry Fried Rice, Seafood and Fish Dishes, they are all awesome.  If you don't mind the humble surroundings and just want great Thai food be sure to try it out when you are on the East side.

Checked out the FREE delivery and very impressed. The food arrived hot and delicious. The appetizer combo was delicious and was the items were crispy.  Combination fried rice was full of meat and shrimp and egg and goodness. I tried the vegetable tom kha and was very pleased. Yes, we will order again.

Delicious-- try the spicy basil noodles.  Really relaxed atmosphere, nice low lighting, friendly staff.  Your water glass will never get more than a third empty!  

Oh, sometimes I really miss Pittsburgh.

I always thought I hated Thai food, but it turns out I just hadn't tried good Thai food!  Thai Cuisine is easily my favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh right now.  As others say, try the curries; they're absolutely delicious.  Their mock duck and "veggie chicken ham" (it really does taste like chicken and ham simultaneously) are very tasty, and a welcome addition to the menu.  And speaking of the menu, Thai Cuisine offers an entire vegetarian menu!

Also, the service here is perfect.  Really.  The servers are incredible.

good authentic thai food

excellent thai basil chicken fried rice

friendly service

i didn't like the thai tea
Some of the best Thai we've had!  Awesome flavors, large menu, wonderful service - will return often and recommend this restaurant to our friends and family.
This is the only place we will go now for Thai food in Pittsburgh.  It's consistent, tasty and the specials keep us coming back.
Bummer. Closed until the end of January 2012 for renovations.

This restaurant is as close to the Thai food I experienced whilst traveling through Thailand.  The flavors are fabulous, the atmosphere and decor lovely.  Lisa, her family and staff do a wonderful job!
I recommend the Panang curry, larb salad, fresh spring rolls and sticky black pudding, to name only a few!
Good food -- meaning they know how to cook delicious and flavorful food. Most important thing.

This used to be my best place.  Something has changed and not for the better.  Last time I ordered from here someone put a ton of tumeric in white rice with some obvious frozen peas and carrots and few pieces of meat, tried to pass that off like it was fried rice.  

But this time, I won't order until things change.  The Pad Thai is a cheap imitation with a few sprinkles of pepper flakes.  The shrimp is so over cooked it's gross.  The wontons were not cooked right and the mystery meat in the middle is still pink.  Used to be able to choose what went inside.  The only saving grace was the orange chicken sauce.  Very slightly sweet and a small tang.  Otherwise the chicken was dry and tasted like it was microwaved.  The BBQ shrimp were not BBQ'd at all.  The shrimp was very greasy but not under cooked. Guess why? Because in the ordering comments I asked them not to over cook the shrimp.  Go figure.

Not sure what happened to this place: new management, short cuts, unhappy cooks or staff members, or just being cheap with ingredients.  Whatever the problem is it is coming out in the food.  Very poor quality for what "used" to be a great place for Thai food.

Very satisfying place to be at . Food is very good . The pad Thai is one of the best I've ever had . Service is great and clean place to eat. Definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone . Thai cuisine rocks

This is my favorite Thai Restaurant in Pittsburgh.  The building may not look like much, but the food is excellent.  The only dish I have ever disliked was the duck curry.  Everything else has been superb. The prices are reasonable and the servers are friendly, too.  It often gets quite crowded on weekends, but the wait is never too long.  BYOB.
Love this place!  Best green curry dish around the Pittsburgh area!!!  It literally cannot be beat!

This place is aces for dinner. I've never been at lunchtime but have always been impressed with their dinner service. They're always busy but manage to have a swift table turnover. The BYOB/W makes it even better. It's nice to be able to bring my own and splurge on dessert.

I have the massaman curry pretty frequently. I also love the tom kha chicken soup.

My husband and i absolutely love this place! We have ordered quite a few items and have always been happy-we have also acquired some favorites like their fried rice-orange chicken and any appetizer! Their food is always hot and fresh when we get it (we tend to order delivery) the staff is super friendly and the food is never greasy and portions are plentiful-we always have leftovers and the food re-heats great! No 'food coma' either lol. Highly recommend!

I must write a review for this restaurant!  :)

I have lived in Pittsburgh for almost 8 years now and luckily found this Thai restaurant early in my move.  Let me start with a little story.  My sister lived in Northern California and was visiting.  We were talking about places to eat and I of course mentioned and suggested Thai Cuisine, knowing how good their food is.  My sister was skeptical, to say the least, mentioning in the same breath that she lives in the San Francisco area, could a place in Pittsburgh actually be that good if not better than restaurants in CA?  I decided to let the food speak for itself  --- and it did!  My sister ordered the red curry (duck with pineapple), her fave dish, and she LOVED it.  In fact, she admitted after that this restaurant was indeed the best she had had - and that it was too bad that it was in Pittsburgh.  

Me personally?  I love the green curry with mock duck (wheat gluten) - and I am not vegan or vegetarian.  I would like to mention that this restaurant has a nice selection of vegetarian and vegan options.  The crispy spring rolls are yummy, especially with the sauce.  The soups are all pretty great.  

You should try this restaurant, it will definitely be worth your time.  And if you like your food spicy, like I do, make sure you tell them you want it thai spicey at 10 out of 10!  :)

Thai Cuisine is my go-to restaurant here in Pittsburgh. I didn't discover it until I had lived in Pittsburgh for almost a year, but since then, my friends and I have been going almost weekly--I think it's becoming an addiction.

They have a good number of tables and a couple of booths, so seating has never been an issue, even when we're with a larger group. The staff are friendly and incredibly attentive; I don't think I've ever had a glass of water that was less than three-quarters full. The food arrives at your table less than 10 minutes after the waiter takes your order. Their spice levels are pretty on point and range from 1-10, but you can always ask for the spice rack if you need an extra kick. I've tried almost all their noodle dishes and a handful of the curries and nothing has disappointed. They make one of the best Pad Thais I've ever eaten. They also have specials that are ever rotating, which makes it nice if you're looking to try something new. In general, everything is flavorful and you get what you order. Portions are sufficient for a solid meal and very reasonably priced.

I might venture and say that this is one of the best Thai places in Pittsburgh, but I know that's highly debated here. I'll just say that it's one of the most reliable Thai places I've ever gone to and I'm happy to frequent it regularly.

My favorite for Thai and how authentic- great service!
No matter what you order you will say "I can't wait return and try something new 
Spring Rolla and Summer Rolls are to die for
This place exceeded all expectation. Great customer service and outstanding quality food. Will go back whenever in town. My son goes to Pitt and took a friend there already. Highly recommend!

Decent. .not the greatest thai food.  Ordered coconut soup on line.. they gave me something else?! Okay..?! .
Check your order before you leave.

Been back several times and it's still our favorite Thai in Pittsburgh. The pad Thai is very good, with a slight smoky flavor that keeps you coming back for more. It's a light pad this, not thick and gloopy, so your friends who only know to eat the pad Thai (assuming you have such friends) won't feel overloaded by their dinner. 

I now know not to eat green curry anywhere else! Did that recently on a trip to England and was bummed.

This has been my favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh for over 10 years.  The service is always friendly.  Lisa, who usually greets you when you walk in, is incredibly nice and accommodating.  The food is the best Thai I've had in the city.  There are a few dishes that I really like at Nicki's and Senyai, but overall, Thai Cuisine wins.  My favorite dishes are Spicy Noodles and Green Curry.  It's enough food that you can take some home.  Morning after breakfast is leftover Thai Cuisine curry.  I can't manage to save it til lunchtime.

i was very excited to try this place.  thai is one of my favorite cuisines ever!!!  but i was sorrily disappointed. we started with spring rolls, through the rice wrapper i could see that the lettuce was browning, a sure sign that the rolls were not made to order.  the pad thai was dry and tasteless.  my friends curry and potatoes tasted like water with a touch of curry powder.  i hate giving poor reviews but nothing that i ate at thai cuisine was yummy.

I have tried the curries and the fried rice dishes and they are all very good. 

tip: it's BYOB
the spiciness is from 0-10. go higher for the noodle dishes.

This is the only Thai I've had so I might just be reviewing Thai food generally as being good, but I couldn't imagine asking more out of this restaurant. The tables and seating look much nicer than the price, which was under $10 for me I believe for just a curry/meat/rice bowl, which was more than filling. My dad ordered the same thing and asked for "9" spiciness, but did not think it was spicy at all. I asked for "5" not really sure what the scale meant and it did not taste remotely spicy (which was fine).

We've gone a second time and both got the same thing as the first. Don't mess with a good thing, I guess!
Awesome!  We ate here several times and everything was very good.  Good service, clean place, and the noodles...

This is absolutely one of my favorite places to eat!  I have been here almost every week for the past couple months.  The food is delicious.  The service is fantastic & friendly. The atmosphere is very pleasant.

Recommended: The curry.  The green is good, and the yellow is to die for.

They have a pretty big menu, along with a separate vegetarian one.  The prices are very reasonable.  No alcohol here, but it's BYOB (only $1 a glass if you bring a bottle of wine).  

I really can't imagine finding better Thai food in Pittsburgh, or anywhere for that matter -- YUM.
Very good food ! Excellent customer service. Ordered the chicken pad thai and the chicken spicy noodle. Overall, highly recommended!

Best curries in Pittsburgh and possibly the best curries I've ever had.  Noodle dishes and appetizers are good, but the curries are the main attraction.   Definitely one of my favorite places in Pittsburgh.
Would rather eat here than anywhere else in the world. Green curry. Pad Thai. Yum yum yum yum yum. 5 Yums on the yum scale. And addictive.
Excellent.  My wife and I had a great meal there last night.  Friendly staff and great food.  In fact the Pad Thai was so good, we ordered some to go.

I have been ordering from this restaurant for well over 10 years, and the food is very good! The people who work there are very nice and always try to make sure you are satisfied. I would highly recommend them, but if you order online, don't use Eat24, just call the restaurant yourself and order on the phone.

Food was great! Taste was on point . Delivery was maybe 10 min late but no big deal. I was still amazed that they had delivery as an option in the east side of town. Definitely ordering in again. You guys made my lazy Sunday :) 

Crab rangoons were soooo good. !!
Medium spicy has a nice kick to it I wonder what hot is like. Every order was good size sharable portions.

Great little hole in the wall restaurant that introduced me to the awesomeness that is Thai food some years ago when I lived in Shadyside. Ended up biking over for takeout once every week or 2.

Living in CA now and haven't been back in about 4 years, and have a fantastic Thai restaurant on my corner, but I still miss Thai Cuisine. The food was great and the staff treated me very well as a regular. Decor and ambiance...lacked a bit but were in line with the prices and the neighborhood.

My wife and I have been coming to Thai Cuisine for many years now even though it's almost a 2.5 hours drive from our house (round trip). We both love Thai food and Thai Cuisine is still the best we've ever had (2nd best so far is in Virginia Beach, VA).

Their Pad See Ew, Three Flavor Chicken, and Thai Spring Rolls are our regular favorites. We also love having their Mango Sticky Rice for desert when it is in season.

Of the many, many good things that come with living in Bloomfield, Thai Cuisine tops the list. I've only ordered take out, but the service has always been above par. The place is BYOB, which means you can have a fancy meal on the cheap. They have a great veg menu, it's not over saturated with fake meat, or light on the protein. Their menu strikes a great vegetable/protein balance for non-meat eaters, and it looks like it does the same for omnivores.

The price is great too, you can get plenty of food for about $10 per person (not including tip or drinks)

Entrees were very good, but the soup and egg roll were at least a day old. I'm sure it's a great place when there are actual customers, but the lack of patronage seems to have made them a little lazy.

My favorite go to for thai comfort food! The staff is always friendly, the food is always hot and prepared exactly the way I ask for it. I'm a lover of very hot food and the spicey basils never dissapoint me. The curry is wonderful and the desserts are perfect. Top off with jasmine tea and add a talkative friend to create the perfect lunch or dinner!
My coworkers and I love this place. We would recommend it to anyone, and everything we try  is great. Why are the egg rolls sooooo good? :)
I always, without fail, order the Green Curry. It is so, so, so good.

Thai Cuisine is the BEST Thai in town!  Hands down.  I've visited most of the other thai places in town (Nicky's Thai Kitchen, Bangcock Balcony, Thai Gourmet, Thai Me Up, Thai Place (fox chapel and shadyside) and they are all inferior to thai cuisine in bloomfield.  Thai cuisine's curries are always sublime.  As my husband said, their curries are like "a party in my mouth".  The flavors are sublimely mixed, like perfect artistry.  
Since it open over 10 years ago, I have been a fan.  I know them on a first name basis as I've been going there for their curry for so long.  Their noodle dishes are good, but the curry is where they surpass everyone in town.  

PS I still have to try "the Smiling Banana Leaf", but I'm always so disappointed by the amount of fish sauce in all of the other curries in town that I can't take trying out new thai places in town anymore.  None of them compare. 

I am the poster child for this place and I tell everyone who comes to Pittsburgh, who will listen, that they must get there asap.
My friend introduced me to this gem in the east side, boy am I glad he did. Great spot for lunch deals and every lunch special comes with soup and egg rolls. Definitely a must try place

We loved our meal and portions are so large we have lots left over to enjoy tomorrow.  To start with, we ordered delivery and it was so easy and fast.
The free spring rolls that came with the order were hot crispy and delicious.  
Then we had the war wonton soup piping hot and chock full of all the tasty chicken shrimp and veggies.  The wontons were really meaty filled and very tasty tender seasoned real good.  The crab Rangoon were huge and stuffed full of crab like no others I have ever had.  really rich and I could only eat one, they are substantial. 
my entree was the Green curry chicken and it was exceptional.  Reflect amount of heat in the curry sauce, veggies tasted fresh picked and it was loaded to the hilt with tender chicken.  
Moms entree was chicken moo goo gai pan 
and she said it was tasty.  
The rice was fresh and we had plenty. 
Glad to have this authentic Thai nearby that delivers.  
I recommend!  Price is right considering huge portions, fresh taste fast delivery.

One of my favorite places around Pittsburgh to eat! A little on the pricey side, but the food is consistently excellent. I especially love the peanut chicken satay appetizer and the red curry entrees. Our waitress has always been friendly and is very knowledgeable about the menu. The rotating dessert menu is usually pretty tasty, too. Atmosphere is quiet--a nice date location. Service is prompt but never rushed.

Delicious Tofu and Veggie Thai Fried Rice, Friendly Waitresses and on point spice level. Crab Rangoon was yummy with good portions. Good value as well. Would return! Also really pleased that they have good veggie options with a separate menu for Vegetarian choices, more restaurants should practice this!

I just went to Thai Cuisine for the first time since it was updated last week and boy has it changed for the better. The decor and space was a tad dingy and dated before. Now its clean and modern. Large decorative shades flow from the ceiling and tasteful artwork hangs on the walls. Even the flatware has been updated. It immediately felt cozier.

Now the big test: did the food get updated?

I rarely stray from the Chicken Pad Thai here so naturally it was an easy choice. It came out steaming. So hot in fact I couldn't even take an immediate bite and I have a metal mouth.

I'm happy to report after it cooled down that the dish had been prepared to match the new look and feel of Thai Cuisine. The sauce was tangy. The bean sprouts were crispy. And the chicken was sliced and cooked to perfection. The dish was drastically better than the last time I had Pad Thai here.

Now Thai Cuisine may not be my all-time favorite Thai food in Pittsburgh but this experience has most certainly put it back in the running.

Welcome back Thai Cuisine.
never had a bad experience until i ordered take out lately, but still pretty solid.

This place is really good.  Everything was so flavorful and cooked perfectly.  Ordered the yellow curry vegetarian and the spring rolls... Great prices and even better food. Showed up on time with everything i needed, plenty of sauce, napkins, plastic ware....  I'll be ordering again soon.....

blandest thai food in pittsburgh I think.  You could really just walk down a few blocks and spend less for better food.  I think the only people that like the food are vegatarians since they have fake meats.  Their sauces literally are all the same, their curries are bad, and everything is way more expensive than it should be.  Their new facade is ugly as can be too.  It looks like someone used some old floor tile from a kitchen and used it as brick for the front of the building.  Looked way better before.
D-

If you haven't been here you are missing out on some serious flavor. The food cooked here is amazing!! And the price is really affordable compared to other places. Feeling lazy? Thy got free delivery! Lunch specials are great don't just take my word for it stop by and have at it
One of the best Thai restaurants in Las Vegas! Really good service! Cheap to dine in! And will definitely be back! Shrimp chow main, tried the soup, had Spicy mint beef! Everything was Bomb!

Ordered for the first time after great reviews. Got pretty sick from the Hawaiian fried rice. So much so I should have gone to the er. Clearly, it was food poisoning. Had all of the symptoms,  it did pass after 24hrs, Contacted them, just to alert them to check their food, however still have not received a return phone call.

The first time I went there they had the cutest little lady who knew my fiance well. He has been dining there for lunch for years. She was so welcoming. She even gave us free won-tons and soup as we waited for our food. The pad thai is DELISH! My favorite is the spicy mint chicken. Get ready to break a sweat but goodness it is worth it. Their Thai tea is extremely good as well. I have yet to not enjoy their food! We feel like regulars when we do go.

My Husband and I have made a Sunday tradition of Mass and Thai over in Bloomfield.  We always make it a point to pick and try one of their specials.  We have never been disappointed, in fact, we asked the waitress what certain new ingredients are and they have always been very educated on the menu.  The server even enlightened us that the chef and cooks go to the strip district each week and compile all their ingredients.  We recommend any of their curry specials, for example "Thai pumpkin, lychee, fried fish, etc".  Also, if you want to try something unique which is sometimes not listed on the menu, ask for the Thai pierogi (Most likely not called that but they'll know what you mean). It's a pillow of potato and Thai spices that bring joy to your mouth and sensations. Also, BYOB :)

Stopped by last night after a long work week. My husband and I have been coming here for over 4 years, while enjoying our coconut chicken soup which was , as always, spiced just right and nice and hot, I was trying to recall, how and when did I discover this palate-pleasing place. I finally figured I have been coming here for over 10 years, my family has eaten here with me, my friends and now my husband, the secret to this place: Food is always better than the last time. It never disappoints and for the price, really? I have grown close to some of the people that work there, and they make it a point to always say hello and come out and greet us.The panang is by far really hard to beat, the mint pork.....finger-licking-good, and of course I can not eat here without the chicken pad thai.....I could go on for days.
The music, the people and of course the quality of the food, all make it a favorite for us.
This place is great! The service is amazing. The seafood soup is so delicious. The music is fun. I am sure I will come back very soon.

I've had better Thai food, but curry was very tasty (had the Red Bean Curry). Red flag when we were served generic green tea (bag) in diner style mugs?!? & charged $2 for a 6oz mug of hit water?!! Green Tea should be served in a tea pot & cups (not mugs). Prefer the other Thai place 2 blocks away - more authentic!
Pretty good pad Thai and drunken noodles. At least better than Thai Gourmet and within walking distance of Children's Hospital.

Might get a higher rating for their regular meals, but the lunch special left much to be desired. Free egg rolls a plus, but the free soup was super salty! We were looking for a Thai experience. The chicken with vegetables just tasted like Chinese take out and although still edible, the curry was probably one of the weakest I've ever eaten. Good deal if you want cheap Chinese lunch. Go somewhere else if you want good Thai food. Service was great. The ladies were really nice.

Great place to eat! Lovely little mom and pop place. The owner always recognizes you and remembers your order. They've got large portions at great prices. During the week they've got incredible lunch specials along with unlimited spring egg rolls. I always get either their Pad Thai Chicken or Pad See Ew Chicken, and it's amazing.

Have eaten at Thai Cuisine many times. The consistency is always good. The restaurant is very clean and comfortable. 

I had the vegetarian eggplant dish with brown rice. They are very accommodating for special requests such as, no mushrooms, and extra broccoli. I asked for it to be spicey, 9/10, and it was perfect. The garlic sauce was wonderful, and the food was not greasy at all (as it is sometimes in Thai restaurants).

My friend had Spicy Basils (have no idea why it is plural) with Chicken and she loved it. 

It's a BYOB place.

I heart Thai Cuisine! Ryan B. and I always go there for our Thai fix! We ordered the Tom Yum shrimp soup, which was so flavorful and hearty, as well as the Won Ton soup, which was a million times more flavorful than what you'd find in the typical Chinese restaurant. 

Our entrees are typically Winter Curry, which Ryan B. LOVES, and Cashew Chicken, which is spicy and delicious. 


Be sure to BYOB, this place is a must!

The service was excellent,  and the food was brought out quickly.  We ordered fried rice, pad see eaw, dumplings,  and ragoons.  The ragoons were cooked to perfection but the filling was 95% crab\5% cream cheese,  and the pad see eaw was a little bland.  The fried rice and dumplings were excellent.   Portions were a great size as well.

My vote for Best Thai in Pittsburgh.  I've tried them all and I keep going back to Thai Cuisine.  Space was completely remodeled a couple months ago.  Hostess/owner is incredibly friendly as are the wait staff.  Get the Green Curry!  My favorite.  Recently had Red Curry with Beef.  Very good as well.

Thai Cuisine is not the place to go if you're looking for ambiance, but the food is great. I went for lunch last week and had Yellow Curry with chicken, which was among the best yellow curries I've ever had. All my meals there have been delicious. The recent lunch service was a little slow -- but they were pretty busy.

This place is great! I got lost trying to find it but so glad I didn't give up. Their Pad Thai is a bit more expensive than what I'm used to, but totally worth it. The staff is so friendly and best of all...they deliver!

Absolutely BEST Thai in PGH. After moving to Pittsburgh from LA at the beginning of 2015 my fiance and I hunted for a Thai place that could compare w/ our favorite place that we left behind. This spot is by far the best tasting, best service in the city. we go often and have never had a meal we didn't enjoy.

Not the best Thai food, but not bad and it is the best in the neighborhood, much better flavor-wise than the other couple Thai restaurants.  I have not tried a huge variety, but the noodle dishes and curries so far have been good.  Fine quality meat, good protein/veggie ratio and flavorful sauces with the correct thickness.  The fresh spring roll is different than what I am used to and probably would not order again.

Well we ordered from an online company and the order was confirmed. An hour later I called no one answered. I emailed the online company who I ordered from and they too did not get ahold of them. My order had to be cancelled because nobody answered the phone. Got my money back and for my inconvenience I was awarded $15 for my next order online. 
I still craved Thai food and ordered from another place. This place answers their phone and delivered my food pretty much on time. 
BEWARE IF YOU ORDER ONLINE, YOU MIGHT GO HUNGRY IF THIS PLACE DECIDES NOT TO ANSWER THE PHONE EVEN IF THEY ACCEPT YOUR ORDER ONLINE!!!

Great food.  Great service.  We dine here at least twice a month and love it. The Pad Thai and bamboo shoot curry are both amazing! I love that they have a spicy scale and you can choose your spice level on any dish.
Not much to say but I like this place. The Thai style fried rice with crab or lobster meat is pretty good. Service is ok and ambiance is good.
Very friendly family owned restaurant .. food is excellent.. love the complimentary egg rolls , rangoons are to die for
Get the Panang Curry Chicken, it'll change your life! Place is very clean, the service is very good and the food is exceptional.

Delicious, Affordable, Great Menu, Friendly Service!  One of my favorite Thai restaurants in the area.  I suggest the 'Bird's Nest' entree.  Newly remodeled and very nice looking!  The food is not very spicy, so if you desire SPICY, you have to ask for it!

When it is a late night dinner, both my husband and I know there is only one place we will be ordering from.  Thai Cuisine has some of the most amazing Asian food,  my favorite is the pineapple rice, and the pot stickers.  My husband likes anything really hot, and their chicken wings.  You must try the place if you haven't already.  My mouth is watering just thinking about it. 

 Note*  Do not order lunch, it came cold, and without the soup they advertise.  The lunch combo's tasted like it came from  an all you can eat buffet !  LUNCH NEVER AGAIN RIP OFF AFTER THIS IT WILL BE AWHILE BEFORE I RETURN FOR DINNER!
This is my favorite Thai restaurant. I love their chicken fried rice. Me and my family have been coming here for the last 5 - 7 years. The owner always greets us and make us feel like we're at home.
Just want to say "Yum! Yum!", & So Far -- So good!

Since the remodel of Jan 2012, gone is the quit peacefullness & the wonderful table settings. This place is much too loud now, & it gets so annoying it sounds like a daycare. Couldn't wait to leave. Food was good as it ever was though, but lack of carpeting & the old dropped ceiling really took away the quiet & romantic charm that the old place had. Lisa, add some carpet & heavy tapestries from the ceiling to kill the noise and I'll be back...... Whose design idea was this anyways? UPDATE: it's long overdue, but they did add sound deadening material, which seems to help. The food is fabulous as it was when they opened years ago. This is our go to Thai place, definitely worth the drive from the north hills.

Pittsburgh has very few good Thai resturants. I ordered here for delivery. It was the best delivery I found in my area for good Pad Se Ew. They only have delivery through Wheel Deliver , which makes it too expensive really to order ofter(would have been five stars if not for the outragious fees to order via wheel deliver). But the food was so dang good! So go in and takeout or sit down.

Wonderful restaurant. Great food. 

My family and I went along with my 14 month old daughter. They had no problem making a special meal just for my daughter because she can't have adult food yet. 

When the adult food came out it was delicious! I will definitely go again!

Best Thai food in Pittsburgh, hands down. My go-to Tuesday night takeout spot.

Pad thai and massaman curry are definitely highlights. Red curry has pineapple, which I personally dislike. Avoid the thai fried rice--it's good but really overpriced. 

The spice levels are made for white people so feel free to venture into the higher numbers. I usually go about an 8 or 9. 

Mostly a take-out place although it can get busy on the weekends.

My wife and I were visiting Las Vegas for our 25th anniversary and had a serious Thai food craving.  We arrived at 10:50 and on a Tuesday and were the first customers there (Lot's of people started filing in about 15 minutes later).

You have probably read how friendly the staff is and I concur.  The staff are actually from Thailand where I have vacationed and dwell the friendliest people on the planet!  Our server greeted us with a smile and asked us to choose our desired "heat" level on a scale of 1 to 10.  My wife who can handle spicy food chose 5 and she would only allow me to choose 4.

I ordered the garlic beef and was utterly pleased with the flavor.  It was just so delicious and satisfying with a nice portion of food.  I had mine with the fried rice after enjoying the delicious soup of lemongrass, tomatoes and lean chicken.  

My wife ordered the chicken curry which was so coconut rich and authentic.  Her heat level of 5 would have been at my max level of enjoyable "heat".  We both said that if this was a 5 GOD help anyone who chose a 10 level.

Wonderful experience.  The price was phenomenal...$7 for the lunch special.  I wish it was closer since we are staying at the MGM Grand Signature.  We just happened to be visiting the Air Force base.

Spicy shrimp soup seafood soup , yellow curry rice crab rice, crab ragoons and spring rolls are wonderful.  Did not like Mongolian beef or szechwuan chicken which are usually my fave at other places. Great staff very friendly service oriented.  This is a Family owned restaurant. They always remember my fiance and I.

We landed here thanks to Yelp reviews. Great little place is like a hidden gem. Food was great and service was just fantastic. We plan to return soon. Portions are large and price is reasonable. We tried both appetizers and main dishes which turned out to be delicious. We tried chicken dumplings, satay, Hawaiian fried rice and hot pot. Everything turned out good. There Is ample paid street parking. So next time, we desire for Thai food, we know where to go.

well i finally took the advice of fellow yelpers and gave Thai Cuisine a shot last weekend.   I showed up at 930 on Friday night and the place was packed.  I had to wait 15 minutes for a table.  I always feel waiting for a table is more of a positive than a negative as it usually means good things are to come.  I started out with the special shrimp fried in wontons.  It was unmemorable and I would of like to have seen bigger shrimp for this 6.95 appetizer.  I ordered the vegetable tom yum soup.  This was outstanding.  The vegetables were large and fresh and the spice was perfect.  I asked for medium and actually got medium.  I went with the standard pineapple curry as i always do the first time at a thai place.  Every bite was enjoyable and again the medium spice was perfect.  Like so often at thai restaurants i am always sad when i get to the bottom of the bowl.    Looking forward to my next visit. (4.5 stars)

This place is great, we as a family went to the restaurant to celebrate a graduation.  I yelped Thai food and realized this place was close and had great reviews.  I got the curry tofu and it was great, the spring rolls where awesome too.  I also had some of the Pad Thai and the drunken Noodles both as good as the first.

This place is a mixture of Chinese & Thai food.

It's quiet and service was good.

We tried a bit of everything, sorry no pictures too hungry to stop and snap a picture of the spread.

We ordered the Tofu Pad Thai, Chicken Penang Curry, papaya salad, Shrimp Chow Mein, Shrimp Fried Rice, Pork Noodle Soup, Chinese Broccoli w/ Crispy pork and Fried Tilapia.

The Crispy pork gets soggy w/ the sauce they add to the dish.  Maybe recommend less sauce or pork on the side to keep it Crispy. 

The Fried Tilapia is served w/ the sauce on the side. 

The wait staff came by a few times to make sure we had everything and to refill our drinks.
 
Will definitely come to this spot again when we're in town visiting family.

This is the best asian food place I have tried in Las Vegas. I'm a 28 year resident in the Las Vegas area and have seen many places come and go. Their shrimp fried rice is especially delicious. Love, love, love this place and it's super friendly staff.

**UPDATE** 
This place went to shit. Must be new management. The prices went up and the quality went down. A slap in the face for somebody who has been coming here since... it's been so many years I don't even know anymore. At least 15 years. ByeBye Thai Cuisine restaurant. It was good while it lasted.

I have been going here for almost five years. The food is great. I always get the tum yum, perfect balance in the taste. You get to pick the levels of spiciness. The chow main is ten times better than Panda's. Service is nothing special but always nice staff.

This place is to die for...way better then those places in Chinatown...the service is great I think it's ran by a family not sure but they give you attention when needed and let you enjoy your meal

I had the Spicy Beef Salad, let me tell you it was beyond delicious that I ordered another one to go to have for lunch the next daytime portion size is perfect and the price is not bad at all...to bad I live on the west side of Las Vegas or else I would be here once or twice a wk...will make it a mission to stop by whenever I am on the east side of town! Highly recommended!!!
I haven't found Thai food that blew me away in Pittsburgh, but the waiter here was incredibly friendly, and my mock duck dish was solidly tasty.

Let me start by saying that I had their weekday buffet lunch about eight years ago and I wasn't impressed.  Either they shot the chef at that time, or they decided to start serving authentic Thai food, I don't know.  Either way, they deliver seriously good Thai food through eat24hours.com.  I think I've mentioned before that I spend quite a bit of time in Thailand, and I really love Thai food; HOT Thai food; AUTHENTIC Thai food.  This time, we ordered Pahd See Ew Gai (chicken noodles), Khao Pahd Gai (chicken fried rice), red chicken curry, and papaya salad with sticky rice.  Foodgasm!  The fried rice and noodles are going to be lunch next week, the rest will be gone by tomorrow.

If you live on the east side and are too lazy/tired/drunk to get to Pon Ocha Soup, get on eat24hours.com and order from this place.

My family has been going here since I was little, the owner is very friendly. The place is always clean if you go for lunch it's free soup and egg rolls, the lunch specials are portion appropriately with your choice of white or fried rice and I think noodles? Haven't gotten anything like that in a while I always get the curry it's just like my grandma's you get to choose your spice level 1-10 which are true to spice lol. I also get the Thai coffee which is something I can't find everywhere. I highly recommend this place if you want some good Thai food at a good price with personable people

Very tasty! One of the best Thai restaurants in Pittsburgh.  They offer an entire vegetarian menu and most dishes can be made vegan, they even have mock-meat options! Staff was very accommodating of our dietary restrictions!

Tried ordering on eat24 and it would not take my order because I was 5.5 miles away. I called the restaurant to check if they would make an exception and they said they would. I was quoted a 45 min delivery time and they showed up in less than 30 mins! I was impressed. They gave me complimentary egg rolls which were a bit cold but they were good. Ordered the pad Thai with shrimp and the chicken panang both mild spicy level. Let me tell you they were perfectly spiced! Food arrived hot and delicious. They even brought me ice for my can soda! They have a new customer for sure !

I'm not a Thai food expert, but I really really enjoy their food.  The 3 spice duck is great, Pad Thai is fantastic, as well as almost all the appetizers.  The servers are so nice and accommodating.  The decor could use updating.  Closed on Tuesdays, which somehow is always the day I'm craving it.

Thai cuisine is within easy access to me, so I order from there a lot, at least once or twice a month. I've always had admiration for them because they've been in the neighborhood for a long time, outliving lots of other businesses in the area.

When ordering for takeout, my meal is always ready when I arrive to pick it up and staff is always very friendly. The food is awesome and so flavorful and part of the reason why I stay a loyal customer.

However, the one time I decided to dine in, I sat waiting for nearly 40 minutes before ultimately walking out. They put priority on their takeout orders and it kind of shows. Plus, last time I ordered from there, they got my order wrong. I always order yellow curry, but they have me red instead.

I definitely recommend this place strictly for the food or unless you have incredible patience. There's a reason why they've stuck around for so long.
Went here because we where looking for Peking duck, we got so much more than that and it was all worth it, it was a little expensive but worth every dollar

I really wanted to like this place but it fell short. I ordered massaman curry, spice level 6. I was so disappointed in the spice level. It was a like a -6 spiciness. I tried to get past that and enjoy the dish anyway. Unfortunately, the flavor was also lacking any sort of punch. No lemon grass, star anise flavors that make this curry dish my favorite. Not a fan. The rice was overcooked in my opinion as well.

If I could give more than 5 stars, I would!

Now, I will be a tad sentimental here.  Thai Cuisine was my first experience with Thai.  A friend brought me there for lunch back in 2006 - and I have been a junkie ever since.  And, to be perfectly honest, I have only found one other place in the burgh that I think has comparable food in terms of taste - and the prices there are much higher.  We live about 45 minute drive from TC so for us to frequent there means that we really do enjoy the food!

Over the years, DH and I have brought many friends to TC.  To be honest, it is not much to look at.  It really is lacking in atmosphere and, to be honest, I would love to see them clean up their restrooms a lot.  But the service is always good and the food - well, the food is so good, I can live with this little "diner".  Besides, we always end up down the street afterwards for a coffee and there are restrooms there :)

We have tried all of the appetizers - DH says it is hands down the best hot & sour he has ever had.  Steamed dumplings are the tastiest in town - good taste but nothing overwhelming (i have had them with so much garlic, I regret eating them). Spring rolls are always tasty & fresh.  BTW - if you go at lunch, they add a tiny salad with peanut dressing to your plate - try not to lick the plate when you are done :)

I think we have tried every curry on the menu - red, green, pineapple, panang, musman, winter.  Winter is always our favorite - a green curry with the pumpkin is to die for.  DH will scrape the bowl on this one. 

I am a noodle junkie.  My favorite here of all the dishes is their Pad See Ew.  I always get it with shrimp which are nice-sized and plentiful.  It is the sauce that differentiates this from other Thai places.  TC uses a sweet black bean sauce that is amazing.  I have tried this dish and it is the sauce that makes this dish.  I have liked their Rad Na and enjoyed the fried rices but I always come back to the Pad See Ew because I know that I can't find comparable anywhere else.

I will admit that we have never tried desserts there. To be honest, we find the portions plentiful and have never wanted dessert afterwards.

If you are looking for atmosphere, head to Squirrel Hill or the South Side or Wexford. If you are looking for tasty food at a reasonable price, this is your spot.  And just remember - there is always takeout!
Love the front stand lady who does take out,  always pleasant and smiling. Favorite thai food in the burgh! Yummmmmmmm!

I've been wanting to try both Thai Cuisine and Thai Gourmet since they're within a few blocks of one another. My verdict is that I prefer Thai Gourmet, food-wise anyway. However, there's no doubt that the overall atmosphere is much better at Thai Cuisine. Thai Cuisine feels cleaner and better decorated. 

In terms of the food, I ordered curry and it was okay. I thought it was very mild in comparison to Thai Gourmet. My husband ordered Hawaiian fried rice and also thought it was ok. It smelled smoky but lacked the taste to match it. One thing I really did enjoy was the fried chicken dumplings, but the downfall is you only get four (and they're tiny!). 

Thai Cuisine was about average to me. I would consider coming back to try it again.

Disappointing.
Let me start by saying that I read several reviews before deciding to order delivery tonight and got my hopes up. The food was so bland and sweet that I couldn't even eat it. Garlic pepper chicken had no heat and tastes like cardboard. Pad Thai had sugary aftertaste that was unbearable. The free egg rolls were over-cooked and wraps were crumbling. Lastly, the dumplings had fat, bone, and grissle in them.

My wife loves this place and has ordered takeout from here many times. I wanted to take her somewhere I know she liked so we decided on eating in here on this visit.

Like any normal visit we were sat promptly and a waitress took our order and gave us our drinks. They started us off with veggie rolls which were alright. They weren't particularly great but it was a free start so it's hard to complain. 

And so we waited for our order. And waited. And waited. And finally over 40 (!) minutes after we had ordered a simple chicken curry I decided this was too long of a wait. After asking the front counter about the long wait and the status of our order and only getting useless shrugs in response, we walked out.

Absolutely ridiculous how long we waited and terrible service to top it off. I guess the wife can choose to still get takeout from here if she wants but any business that values their customers so little does not strike me as a place that is worth your time or money. Specially with how many great options for Thai food there are in the area.
Thai Cuisine is a good Thai restaurant, but the atmosphere is lacking. It feels akin to eating in a high school teachers' lounge (including the musical selections).

DO NOT EAT HERE!!!!!!!!

I don't know how/why some of these people gave them a decent review?

This place is Terrible, I literally had to throw the food away.

I'm not exaggerating - the food is awful and overpriced!

I've eaten at 100s do Asian food spots around the worlds and this was a straight rip-off!

STAY AWAY!!!!!!!!!!

Holy crap!  I just ordered delivery while in town on business-- The Thai Cuisine roll and the Thai Basil Chicken.  They were both fantastic!  And I mean it!  I have eaten a lot of Thai, and this stuff rocked.  Perfect spiciness and delicious ingredients.  If I lived here, I would be going once-a-week.  Great job, TC!  WooHoo!

(BYOB)
Went here for Saturday lunch with my husband, and we had some GREAT Thai Food! Although they open at noon, we were there a few minutes early and they seated us.  I'm a vegetarian so I really loved the fact that they had a separate menu with only vegetarian options. Made it easier than scanning through the entire menu. Prices are good! We shared spring rolls, pad Thai, green curry with 2/green teas for $31.
The interior was okay. Not very fancy, but fine. We will definitely be going there! The portions are big too, so we had some food to take home, which is always nice!

I come here often and I love it. For some reason today they were cheap on the rice, but the yellow curry never fails it's perfect. At some Thai tea to top it off and you have a perfect mix. I recommend this place to anyone you wants great Thai food for a reasonable price.

The Tom Kha is delicious. All of the curry's hit the spot as well, my favorite is the red bean. Thai Cuisine has many traditional dishes as well, don't be afraid to try something you've never had before. As far as my decade of experience goes here, all of the food is good.

I want to give this place three and a half stars.  Half an extra star because of how well they handled a complete dirt bag when I was in there.  He refused to pay any more of his bill than ten dollars, and he was very adamant about it as he left.  There was no reason for that.  They were very dignified in how they dealt with him.  
As for the place itself, I give it one star for service.  They were very prompt and attentive.  I give it one star for price and quantity, as the lunch was an entre, soup and egg roll appetizer, all for $6.95.  I also give it one star for the taste.  The soup was very light and the kefir lime leaves made it very bright and refreshing.  The eggroll was not very palatable, but if I ate sauces I may have enjoyed it more.  My friend had the orange chicken, which he loved.  The breading was not too thick, nor was the sauce.  I'd say that and the soup were the best things we had there.  It also wasn't too sweet.  My pahd thai was good, but a little heavy on the sauce.  I wasn't able to finish it all, but it also came with a very light fried rice that was good. 
If you are looking for an inexpensive place to do a quick thai lunch in this area, I would say this place is worth a try.
Food has good flavor. But service is very slow. Decor ia rather dated. Close to Nellis Air force base. Price reasonable.
this place is surprisingly good. lots of vegetarian options. great prices. good service. worth a  trip to the Hood.

This is hands down the best Thai I've ever had.

The Tom Yum Veggie Soup is AWESOME. And I got the spicy basil and it was SO GOOD.

I obviously don't need to get into it too much since this place is clearly very popular and we all agree it's delicious, but someone freaked out at me about how I needed to try the soup, so I'll freak out at you: TRY THE SOUP.

Spicy chili mint combination fried rice ... Wow!
Pa Nang chicken .... Double wow!
I've eaten here a couple times. Very friendly staff and great food.

Me and a friend came across this place on yelp and decided to check it out. Upon entering your greeted by such friendly people. The service was prompt and very attentive. We ordered Penang curry and orange chicken. It was delicious! We were very surprised being that it is on a not so fancied side of town. This place is a must try if you are in the area! We are definitely fans and will become regulars. Later in the week I ordered delivery and on the phone the lady was so sweet! The people that run this restaurant are just the most warm people ever. Oh! And the the free egg rolls are a plus too!

Thai Cuisine is one of the best Thai places I've been to in the States - finding it in Pittsburgh was a real surprise.  The food here is outstanding, and the service is comparable to what I'd expect in a $50/person restaurant, and this place is definitely not $30/plate.  With appetizers, Thai iced tea, and two entrees, my girlfriend and I paid about $30.

I highly recommend the cold chicken and sprout salad.  Wish I could remember the name of it, because it's heavenly.  (...Which probably assumes that heaven looks like Thailand.  ...Which would be a nice place to spend eternity.)  Thai iced tea is really good, too.

My favorite Thai place in Pittsburgh. My family and I have been going here for years. The owners and other staff are such friendly people.

They have an extensive vegan / vegetarian menu and are willing to accommodate any dietary need. Be sure to let your server know if you are vegan or have issue with dairy as the curry contains milk but can be omitted. 

The only negative thing about this place is that they are closed on Mondays.
Favorite thai food place on the east side. Food is always delicious. Delivery is definitely worth the wait!

I've been searching for these wide noodles since I left Denver 12 yrs ago. Spices well balanced, textures are fantastic. They ask what spice level 1-10, we had 7, could go for an 8. A little pricey for lunch, but you get what you pay for. Clean dining area, clean rest rooms. You know the cute Asian girl on Modern Family? The little girl in the back is cuter. Go here! Delivery through Wheel Deliver.

I go here once a week it's amazing I love it and the staff is super nice always friendly and just a great place to grab a bite also it's BYOB and they give you great takeout sizes. I wish I could give more stars!!

We've lived at the base of Sunrise Mtn for nearly 3 years, but when we wanted Thai we would scurry back to Henderson.  One day while we were out and about, we were hungry and decided to give Thai Cuisine a shot and WOW!  Their Thai food is great!!  So much for my illogical snotty attitude...but I digress.  We shared chicken satay and red curry, and both were fab to the extreme.  We sent some friends to try Thai Cuisine and they agreed that Thai Cuisine can stand up to the other good Thai restaurants in town.  Ambience is okay, a bit brightly lit at night, and they don't serve beer (rats), but all in all this is solid Thai food.

Really good Thai food especially for the price, remember when you see those 3-4 star reviews to check that person's history. Food snobs are hilarious with the stuff they nitpick about. For $8 the chicken pad thai is awesome, that's the same price as McDonalds for REAL fresh cooked food. The staff is also awesome I've been there several times and they seem like a very nice family. I cook Thai food at home and eat it a lot and this place is a great go to for a quick lunch or an easy dinner.

We ordered here for two day straight. We had the pad Thai which was not good. Lack of flavor and it seemed dry. The yellow curry medium was amazing on the other hand. The second day, we ordered pad see eaw (spelling) and it had a lot of meat. The beef was tender and had a lot of flavor. The vegetables in the noodles was cooked perfectly as well. Then, we also got yellow curry again medium. This time around it was way too spicy for our taste and killed the curry. Food came in 20-30 mins and it was boiling hot still which was awesome.

I will start my review by saying that I am not a Thai food expert, but I love Thai Cuisine!  My friends have a hard time talking me into trying any other Thai restaurant as I keep coming back here.  I'm hooked!
10/10! Every time my fianc and I come here we have such a lovely time at a reasonable price. Extremely friendly staff and perfectly delicious food every time.

This place has a nice neighborhood feel that I enjoy on a Friday night.  I got the steamed chicken dumplings, Tom yum soup, and chicken spicy noodles. The steamed chicken was Ok, nothing great.  The soup was spectacular despite it being extra spicy.  I got a 9 spiciness for the soup and entre.  For the entre it was perfect, but for the soup an 8 would have been better.  The spicy chicken noodles was very solid.  The portion was huge.
They always remember me and my boyfriend and the the owner always makes it to our table to welcome us back and have a sort conversation.  Food is always consistent and delicious.

Enjoy the pumpkin curry that is not in the menu. You have to ask for it. The shrimp toast appetizer is very good.

Never had a bad meal there.
My favorite Thai food place. I highly recommend ordering the daily specials--especially anything with duck.
I just had the best red Thai curry I've ever had in my life here! Very good highly recommended!

Always delicious, i think the best dish I've had here is the Thai Eggplant dish with whatever kind of meat or tofu you want.  Their Tom Yum is also amazing.  Have been here several times and I love it

I absolutely love Thai Cuisine. I initially found this spot while searching Yelp for new vegan spots close to Shadyside.

I called to be absolutely sure they can veganize menu items and to my excitement, they could! They were incredibly nice and understood my concerns, a lot of Thai restaurants have fish sauce hidden in every dish, but this place does not! 

It's easy to order there and online (via grub hub), all you have to do is make a note that the dish needs to be vegan and it even prints off on the receipt, so when they drop off your order you get some additional piece of mind.

The cashew entree with tofu/veggies and the green salad are a must. The tofu is fried but not crispy amid all the veggies & comes with rice to soak up the mild chili sauce. The salad is fairly simple with greens, cucumber, onion etc. but the dressing or sauce as I would say, is stellar. It's a peanut/coconut milk sauce and I can honestly say I would gladly eat this every day for the rest of my life.

Hit or miss, for me. 

The service here is excellent. I've only gotten take-out, but the lady who always seems to be handling orders is super nice. That's a huge plus. 

I've tried a few things here and I like them - their pad thai is good, as are their basil noodles. I really love their tom yum soup. The thing that makes me sad is the curry. 

I have tried the panang, green and red curries here and ...they kind of taste the same, which is disappointing. I blame this on the coconut milk, because the three times I have ordered  curries from there, they were all extremely watery/milky and the coconut milk overpowered the rest of the flavor. Unfortunately, the milk seemed to dilute the spice as well (that or my level 5 green curry was spiced identically to my boyfriend's level 9 panang curry). They were still tasty, for sure, but coconut milk soup isn't what I normally expect for my curry. 

I'd suggest their noodle dishes without reservation, but for curry, I'd point someone down a few blocks to Thai Gourmet.

What a gem of a place, situated as it is amongst the Italian eateries in Bloomfield, Pittsburgh's Little Italy. This is my favorite Thai restaurant in the city, and arguably the best. I've not had a bad meal here, and everything I've tried has been delicious, with the green curry standing out in my mind as one of the best I've had anywhere. We came here with a large group of people one night, some of whom had never had Thai food, and all left happy and appreciative of my excellent taste when it comes to choosing restaurants. (pat, pat, pat). One of my friends had the springroll and liked it so much he ordered another for dinner. Service here is always good, with a friendly and professional staff that takes the time to help you with ordering. The one downside is that parking is a challenge, as this is a busy street in a bustling neighborhood. I usually find parking on a sidestreet, and would brave much more difficult hurdles to get to this food.

This is my second time getting food from this place. The first time we ordered pad Thai and it was nothing amazing.

Tonight I ordered green curry which is my favorite, as well as chicken satay with extra peanut sauce.

Both the peanut sauce and curry were super watery. This is so disappointing. I wanted to love this place as it's so close to our house, but damn. Are they just trying to save a buck? Is this normal for them? I didn't order curry essence, I ordered curry! Boo.

Time to try another place, I guess

Still sticking with my original rating.  Just had dinner here last night.  The decor is great with the new remodel and all, and the food is still solid.  I give it 3 stars because I find it to be good/serviceable Thai food, but certainly not the best in the city.  I had the eggplant dish, which was hot, fresh and tasty, but what disappointed me was the lack of requested spice (level 9).  When I ask for something to be spicy, make it spicy.  Simple request, no?  Nevertheless, I still recommend this restaurant because the quality is good, the service is good and price is right.  A great spot in the Bloomfield neighborhood for sure.
Consistently good, reasonably priced Thai.

Let me start this by saying I got on the wrong bus and ended up walking from Garfield to Bloomfield and then once in Bloomfield I proceeded to get lost behind West Penn Hospital. With that being said I was hoping that all my stumbling around in the elements would not be in vain.   

The food at Thai Cuisine is more pitiful than my sense of direction. I ordered Threes Company: shrimp, scallops and calamari in a Thai chili sauce. The sauce is my favorite part of a Thai meal but Thai Cuisine came up short here. What I enjoy must about a Thai chili sauce is the complexity of flavors but this sauce in my dish was your standard thin runny brown sauce.  The kind that comes with lets say beef and broccoli.  I think the menu description was misleading and had I known it would be brown sauce I would have ordered something else.  

Some of the onions in my dish were cold which leads me to believe that the food was not cooked to order or at least not all of it.  There was plenty of shrimp in the dish and the calamari tasted great, but the dish lacked flavor. The carrots and broccoli was cooked beyond recognition.

For my hubby I ordered the Thai steak , it tasted like a frozen salisbury steak dinner and salisbury steak just so happens to be one my least favorite foods.  Had I not sampled his dinner this would have been a solid three star review. 

I see no reason to go back here.

!!!!!FREE SPRING ROLLS!!!!

This is literally my first review ever. I always read reviews but I'm too lazy to write em but whatever I will get strait to the point because this place deserves this review.

1. Lady on phone was nice as fk 
2. Delivery Man was nice as fk and actually talked to me for a minute. I'm an introvert(kind person but almost anti social), that being said it still didn't annoy me. 
3. Price was good, food wasn't nasty looking smelly and didn't taste rubbery 
4. I ordered fried rice and garlic chicken.. Both were good and I got a free side of white rice and 4 free spring rolls. Yea.. 4 free spring rolls lady and gentlemen oh yea and they charge .50 for can of sodas 
5.  And they weren't stingy with the sauce 

For what this place is.. It's the best local bang for your buck! 

China Kitchen is good too but this place is an overal winner but China kitchen offers fried chicken wings 

Hong Kong kitchen(or something like that) I never tried because their reviews were terrible.

I was SO in the mood for Mexican I could taste the salt water of the Gulf all the way from Pittsburgh. Unfortunately, my favorite Mexican joint was closed, Lot 17 smelled like the day after a frat party, so Thai Cuisine it was.  So - you know when you're really looking forward to one thing, so the next thing will just stink in comparison? That's how a felt. Even as a Thai-lover, I just couldn't imagine anything other than chimichangas, and I don't even LIKE chimichangas.  Well, Thai Cuisine turned my Mexican frown completely upside down.

I started with the fresh Thai rolls; a deliciously fresh spring roll that almost gave Trams' spring rolls a run for their money...almost.  For my main course I chose the day's special - Winter Curry with Shrimp.  A delightfully sweet mix of large shrimp, perfectly cooked potatoes and vegetables PLUS an amazing thai-type of squash similar to pumpkin swimming in luxurious creamy curry, this meal demands a return trip. Terrific, simply terrific (BYOB, btw).  Our server was incredible to boot, so yay for Thai Cuisine.  Kind of a boring title though - might I suggest "Thai My Hands & Call Me Satisfied!"  Wait - no, that came out wrong...

I always order delivery from this place i have yet to go to the actual location but i love to order from here i generally purchase there egg rolls every time i order their delivery. The orange chicken isnt to bad. They usually come way before it says its supposed to get here which is great i will make it a habit to order from here often

Before commenting on the food for this place I have to state that I am not the biggest fun of Asian cuisine.  I was found over there accidentally, since my friends wanted to go there.  Despite this fact I found it interesting place.  The food was well cooked and tasty.  Service was fast and in general a nice, warm atmosphere.  For the record, my company that is into Asian food, love this place (so I assume it is a nice place for whoever likes eastern cuisine).

Walked in with a hankering for Thai tea boba & maybe food. But I definitely changed my mind on the food when I walked in. It was dingy looking & the pics of the food didn't look very appetizing. 

Anyway I order the Thai tea w/boba & the boba looked very old & disgusting. I tried it anyway. The boba's texture was the WORST I have ever tasted or felt. It was falling apart & really slimy. I took it back & the staff acknowledged that I was given old boba! WTF?! They offered me new boba & apologized. Why would you knowingly serve something that should have been thrown away weeks ago?! Anyway, they were nice about it but BEWARE of their entire menu. I wouldn't be surprised to see them on an episode of dirty dining.

A surpringly good, authentic Thai restaurant, despite the advertisement of Chinese, Thai Cuisine was a delight.  I had the yellow curry, pad see ewe, egg rolls, and Thai iced tea.  The Thai iced tea was sweet, but not too sweet.  The pad see ewe we had was with chicken, and the meat was plentiful.  The flavor was very good, and the Chinese broccoli was fresh and tasty.  Even the noodles were tasty, and no grease!  

The yellow chicken curry surprised me the most.  It was styled just the way I like it, similar to the (old) Thai Grill: soupy, but flavorful.  I was quite delighted to find another Thai restaurant that makes curry this way instead of the usual Indian style.  The curry wasn't as flavorful as the (old) Thai Grill, but it was definitely good!

I recommend this Thai restaurant for the Thai dishes.  I haven't tried the Chinese dishes, and I don't plan to, but chances are that they are tasty as well.  I will be coming here often since it is close to my work!

Thai Cuisine is the slightly pricier of the two Thai places near my house, so for super casual takeout purposes I usually just go to Thai Gourmet. Their Pad Thai is delicious and enough for four meals. I also adore the girls who work the front of the house there. Thai Cuisine's food tends to be a bit more flavorful however, and sometimes that's just what I want without having to drive somewhere. 

My boyfriend and I ordered from here the other night, and I must say I think we'll be back for a sit-down meal fairly soon! I tried their version of Pad Thai since I hadn't had that in a while, and he had spicy basil friend rice. The Pad Thai had a tamarind sauce, which I've been led to believe is more authentic. Authentic or not it had that red spicy edge that I prefer in Pad Thai, and I couldn't get enough of it! Most Pad Thai around here is a sweet brown sauce, which is fine but not as complex. The Thai place near my mother's house makes their Pad Thai the way I like it, and I've been on an unofficial hunt to track down a similar version of the dish nearer to where I live. The hunt is now over! The portions here are a bit smaller for the higher price point, but the taste and quality balances it out very well. The service has also been great whenever I've come in, something else that I really appreciate. I'll for sure be back for more takeout and with visiting friends for a proper dinner very soon.

This is our favorite go-to place. I have not been disappointed by anything I have tried here. Love all of the curries. The pad Thai is the best I have tried anywhere, even outside of Pittsburgh. The Hawaiian fried rice is amazing!

My wife and I came to this restaurant due to having the craves for pad Thai for the night. We got there before 9pm Saturday night.  We were welcomed with 4 egg rolls and sauce along with our menus. The waiter was super quick.  We ordered the shrimp fried rice, pad Thai noodles chicken, and green chicken curry.  The waiter asked us what spicy level we wanted from 1-10, 10 being ultra spicy and 1 being mild. Wife chose 2 for the spice level which was the right choice because overtime the dish became spicy.  The meal came to us around 10-15 minutes.  The fried rice was awesome and delicious.  I haven't that good of fried rice in awhile.  Of course the pad Thai noodle was delicious as well and I would come back to this restaurant again!  They also deliver too so call them up if you can't make it to their place.  Lastly, we were also given banana rolls as a special for the week.
This was gross and a waste of 28 dollars. My curry was a few strips of chicken and chunks of potatoes in a giant tub of milk. Thai gourmet a few blocks down is awesome...too bad they were closed.

Once again, I found myself craving curry...

This is the story of my life. I fiend for good curry. This place has GOOD curry.
I got the green curry with duck (love it!). It was creamy, spicy, a tad sweet and nutty.

The only reasons this place gets 4 stars instead of 5 is A) The spiciness was not on par with the 7 I had requested and B) The waitress didn't seem too happy to be there. But maybe she was just having an off day.

P.S. If you're a crab rangoon junkie, you MUST try them here!

Very solid Thai place. I have the fried spring rolls, which was good (crispy flaky crust, but the filling wasn't anything to write about), the vegetarian tom yum soup (pretty good, but honestly I've had better tasting broth), and the winter curry.  The curry was interesting, but the kabocha squash (which i'm a fan of) didn't seem to fit in right with the curry.  The curry itself was good and the dish was a good effort.  My gf had the vegetarian pad thai.  She thought it was good, but a little too soupy (too much fluid).

Also, they offer most things spiciness from a scale of 1 to 10.  They said 5 is good, but I tasted almost no spice.  I'd go for a 10 next time.

From what I read this places is among the best in Pitt, and I can see how this might be true.  Next time I'm in Pitt, I'll definitely consider coming back.

Me and my friend had a "Bangkok Seafood" and a "Thai Treasure Hot Pot". Both of them were very delicious, except the yellow curry in the seafood didn't seem quite well dissolved. To be fair, it happens a lot for Thai/Indian food, which therefore didn't bother us enjoy our great dinner.

I came here a year or two ago and can't forget about it ever since. Finally I made my way back here and grabbed take out. It was just delicious as I remembered! The place isn't classic and quite cozy. Drunken noodle is my all time favorite!!

Hands down, the best Thai food I've ever had!

I think their specialty are their curries.  You can't go wrong with any of their curries.  

I think their other dishes are good, but not all of them are in the same level as their curries.  Their pad thai was good and their spicy calamari was a bit underwhelming.

For appetizers, I've tried their taro roll (good!) and their thai spring rolls (good as well!).  For soups, I've tried their Tom Yum soup and it was excellent - just not served in a easy-to-ladle-and-serve container.

BUT, with that being said, head straight there and order their curry!  It's excellent!

Came back to my favorite restaurant for dinner after not being here for MONTHS (is that a sin?) and I was SO excited.

We had to start off with the crab rangoons- of course. Thai Cuisine has them down to a T. They were perfect and the sauce was awesome.

I wanted to try something different, so per our wonderful server's suggestion- my friend and I split the eggplant entre with beef and the spicy basil noodles with chicken. We ordered both at a whopping 11 (1-10 heat scale). After talking with our server about Thai heat levels, he informed us that if we enjoy spicy food we should order above the "American 10". He told us that "Thai hot" is a 15. We took a chance with ordering it at 11 (I normally stick with the 5-6 range) and it was a good decision! The food was AWESOME and wasn't too spicy at all. The eggplant dish was amazing- the chili garlic sauce was OUT of this world and of course, they are always generous with the sauce- which I adore. The spicy basil noodles were amazing.. I have been dreaming about those noodles ever since.

When it comes to Thai food, Thai Cuisine is where it's at. The food is AWESOME, the service is always consistent and wonderful and they are also BYOB. You can't beat it.

Had the fried tofu appetizer, pad Thai with tofu, and Thai iced tea. Giving this place a 2 star bc the tofu tasted like it had gone bad, I addressed it to the waitress and she just told the kitchen without apologizing for the bad taste of the tofu. The noodles were not bad, but the quality of service based off of experience deserves a low grade for this place. Was unsatisfied with the experience, and I always will comment and connect my rating experience with customer service. 

I did not ask for a discount for the bad food nor did I throw a fit to the waitress, I think anyone would have wanted to be acknowledged for having to eat bad tofu...

This place has really delicious authentic Thai food.  My favorite from them is the Curry Fried Rice.  I haven't found any other restaurant that has made it that way.  What's also good is the Seafood sour soup.  It comes with a plentiful of shrimp, scallops, squid, and octopus.  Delicious in flavor and broth.

I don't quite like the Pad Thai though, to me it has kind of a sweet taste with just isn't accord with me.  I prefer the Pad Thai from Pin Kaow, which is separate when you get the Pad Thai you put the bean sprouts, peanuts, and dressing in it.  That's what I'm more used to when I had it in Viet Nam.

Honestly was super cheap! LOVE chicken mint chili & crab things. Not a big fan of there orange chicken but it's a great price for deliver! $16 feed me and my boyfriend who eats a ton! 16 dollars got me a bunch of white rice, lunch special( feeds two)  of spicy chili mint chicken which more fried rice! Carb Rangoon & two cans of soda FOR $16.75 like with free delivery. Love this place. But I hate the Mexican lady who took my order. She didn't know I spoke Spanish and she was telling the other guy how she can't understand me and was being rude to me because she didn't know English. NOT MY FAULT.

Great currys. Affordable. And not super fancy. This place is within walking distance to my house which clearly means it's perfect for a quick dinner, or to walk over and get carry out. I enjoy eating thai food at least once a week so this place has become a pleasant staple in my diet.

mussaman and panang curry are my go to eats here. and I strongly believe that I could live on it (and i'm trying to)

oh and crab rangoon is totally not thai, but delightful nonetheless.

One of my favorite Thai restaurants in Pittsburgh (actually, one of my favorite restaurants overall). I typically order take-out/Grub Hub, and the food is always prepared quickly, packed well, and tastes delicious. As far as appetizers, I've had the steamed Pork Buns (a "special" that is pretty much always on the menu, as far as I know), which are phenomenal. Everyone raves about Noodlehead's Pork Buns, but I think these may be better. The chicken satay and spring rolls are great as well.

My S.O. typically gets the house noodles or one of the curries (favorites including panang, green, and yellow). My favorite dish on the menu is the hawaiian fried rice. There is such a variety of flavors and textures in the meal that combine to make a great entree overall.

Finally, the servers are all fantastic and the owner (I think she is the owner - she is almost always at the front of the house) is so sweet and sincere. Seeing her is always a pleasure!

I surmised two things from my visit to Thai Cuisine:

a) the competition among thai restaurants must not be very stiff in this town

b) yinzers wouldn't know good thai food if it flew into their open mouths

This place was horrible. My fried trout was just a battered butterflied fish not much different from what you'd find at a church fish-fry. Insipid, over-battered and generally unpleasant. My dining partner's masaman curry was so sickly sweet it tasted like melted coconut ice cream. Surprisingly, the joint was slammed. 

On the bright side, service was very fast. On the downside, our waitress was definitely stressed out and cranky possibly from waiting on the 14-top of inebriated co-eds across the room from us.

The takeaway: If you're from Pittsburgh, you'll probably love this place -- it was packed with your kinsmen when I was there. But if you've enjoyed quality thai food in any large coastal metropolis, steer clear.

p.s. food was needlessly pricey given the poor quality.
