I had no problem with the service, they gave us some free eggrolls as well.  Good stuff.  There was also a lady who fell over a table when she arrived in the store, looking back that probably was hysterical.

Sorry Yelpers, no real interesting stories here.  Just a solid establishment

#DontThaiMeBro
#TheGoodLife
#Level10CurryKickedMyAss

Wow, yes, a place that delivers to my house that is NOT pizza. 

Ordered Chicken Curry (yellow, medium) and a Thai Salad (pretty basic), and I got the complimentary egg rolls with the delivery order.

Curry was all right. Not the best I have had, but maybe they do it better in the store? I can't imagine it would be all that different though because it seems as though the moment I put in my order it magically appeared at my door. Yes, that fast I tell you! By the way, delivery charge was... FREE! Yes, I ordered off of Eat24 and this was the only place around me that was not charging a delivery fee.

My Thai Salad was good, lots of tomatoes and cucumbers. Very fresh and of course a nice compliment to the curry. I like to eat the salad and curry at the same time. It just seems to cleanse the palette so you don't have spicy, spicy coming at you the entire time.

The egg rolls were quite yummy. I like to dip them in the spicy chili sauce - I wish they'd given me more instead of bringing a cup of the sweeter sauce. 

Overall I loooooved my food, right in the comfort of my own living room.

We order delivery from them all the time and every single time THEY TAKE FOREVER!!! On the upside, the food always comes hot and yummy!! So I guess it makes up for the hour of wait. The delivery guys were always nice and friendly, too. So be sure to tip them good! Just don't order from them if you're super hungry. You might die from starvation.

Also, the "1-10" spiciness scale is a lie. No matter how high or low I choose. The spice still burns my tongue off. Choose 0. They will still give you a tinnie tiny bit of spice.

This was some of the tastiest Thai food I've had in LV. The chicken coconut soup was really great and served in a bowl with a small active volcano in the middle to keep it hot. They brought us a double order of egg rolls-we only ordered one. My wife had yellow curry that was great, my one complaint being that the curry broth was a little too white and had just a hint of "curry" flavor. Also there wasn't quite enough of the broth that I am used to with other places. It was more thick like a sauce. These are minor complaints about the dish as overall it was quite good. We will definitely go back! 

Ignore what your GPS says-it is on the Northwest corner of Pecos and Nellis. My GPS is nearly 10 years old though.....

Oh my, Thai Cuisine, how I miss living a few blocks from you.  
This is my favorite Thai restaurant in Pittsburgh.  I couldn't even begin to count the number of times that I have been to this place. I mean it when I say everything is delicious.  I have had multiple curries, noodles, and apps, and none have disappointed.
A few of my favorites, Chicken Dumplings (steamed or fried), Thai Spring Rolls, Pad Thai (naturally), Thai Cuisine Bird Nest, and Spicy Basil Noodles.  
Service here is always on point, even when they're busy.  This place is BYOB, so bring your favorite adult bevie and enjoy. While a smaller restaurant, they happily can accommodate larger parties. 
While they don't deliver, you can get take out, so you can bring home a yummy Thai treat.

I need to go here again asap!!! :)

Leaning more towards 3.5, but that isn't currently an option...

I went here with a group on a Saturday night during Little Italy Days. I've tried getting in here before on a Saturday night and was turned away because they were so full so close to closing time, so I was thankful to find empty tables and room enough for our party of 6.  

As one reviewer said before, the service was very attentive. I'd rather have a server who checks up on me too much than one who disappears for 40 minutes though, so it was no bother. I cannot complain at all about the service during the meal...she was prompt and very attentive and a water glass was never empty the entire time.

Straying away from my usual green curry, I got the spicy noodle dish at a level 5 out of 10. I can honestly say the noodle dish didn't have that much of a kick at all and despite being delicious on it's own, I added a good amount of sriracha to it. 

Another dining companion said his curry wasn't hot enough either and he ordered an 8 out of 10, but he's also an absolute sadist when it comes to spice. The food was mediocre. Not the best thai I've ever had, but certainly not the worst. 
 I tried a piece of my friend's honey duck and it was absolutely delicious. Another diner was pretty "meh" about her dish as well and didn't finish it, but I liked what I had despite it not being hot enough. I would certainly come back during lunch and give this place another try.

Main problem came at the end with the check. We were a group of 6 and were told they couldn't split the check (which I expected) but they could take up to three forms of payment. No problem, we dividied up the bill according to who got what and told her which card goes with which dish. 

We were then told that we have to give her the exact amount we wanted charged on each card and it had to all equal up to the total on the bill. That may sound simple, but with tax and gratuity it was RIDICULOUS sitting there like I was in math class working out who was going to charge what on their card. Left a sour taste in my mouth, as any modern day POS system could have done in seconds what I spent the better part of 10 minutes trying to figure out. Didn't help that she gave us 'tude about it, either. 

Anywho, I may come back and try it, but certainly never in a large group format again.

Really really good !
Just moved to East Vegas, wanted a good restaurant ! Found one.  
Had:
Crab Cheese Rangoons (delish)
Chicken Satay (fabulous)
Chicken Yellow Curry (perfect taste & after taste)
Spicy Mint pork with lots of veggies, spice level 4 (sooo good)

I will definitely return ! This was a great experience & the staff was superb.
Plus they comped us wonton rolls that were sooo good.
Stay away from the lunch special and soup bar. I usually order from the menu where they prepare the food better. Get the seafood tom yum soup , and combination fried rice with Thai ice tea

I've been here twice so far and it is actually very good. I'm extremely judgmental when it comes to thai food and though the food wasn't perfect (but it was satisfying) i'm still going to give it four stars because I have yet to find a better thai place in Pittsburgh that isn't a murderously long drive away from our house.

July 11 2015; we came in this coconut aroma place craving for thai food taste. Since me and the hubby want to keep the carbs low, we ordered chicken satay, fried squid and tomyum soup.the chicken satay taste amazing. It has cucumber salad and peanut sauce that goes well with it. The breaded squid with sweet and sour sauce taste superb. It didn't taste oily at all. The Tomyum soup is very delicious that it will make you feel rejuvenated after you eat it. This place is worth a try if you're looking for thai food restaurant.

I'm giving this place 5 stars for fantastic chicken satay! Oh and their taro boba was a ok a bit on the sweet side though for my taste. The watermelon boba Tasted better than I thought! I will be going back! Oh brought back the satay for my family that said a party was in their mouth lol

Took a friend to chow down at this thai restaurant. 

PROS: Have had the pad thai, wide noodles w/ black bean sauce, and mango curry here. All were good. The front desk was very welcoming. Decent prices ($10- 12/dish). They also have a daily specials menu, at least for dinner.  

CONS: Crab rangoon was overfried- wouldn't recommend this appetizer. Side street parking. 

Overall, will be back to check out the rest of the menu.

I have tried every Thai place I can get my hands on and none compare to the quality of flavor and balance at Thai Cuisine. The family that owns it runs it and how much they care shows. I usually order Penang curry tofu or a dish that's not on the menu tofu noodle soup. Lunch specials are a good deal too.

We've been eating at Thai Cuisine since it opened many, many years ago. The food was great but, in all honesty the food has been on the decline...you want specifics? here they are: We ordered the Tom Yum Veggie Soup (we ordered the Hot Pot, which technically they no longer have but gave us 3 orders of the soup). guess how many pieces of tofu were in each bowl of soup....4? 3? 2? Nope. 1. So, I called and they refunded one of the cups of soup ($3.50)- honestly, i don't think this was the best remedy but, whatever. My eggplant with tofu had exactly 6 small pieces of tofu. Now, let's be real, tofu is CHEAP. the asian food store in the strip sells blocks of it for less than 30 cents...and those blocks make up 6 pieces o' tofu thai cuisine style...so, please explain this one....anyway, i'm just not happy with the price of the dishes and what's inside...it's really the beginning of the end when restaurants get this high on themselves.
Best Thai spot I've ate so far. Just moved to Vegas and I been here 3 times already! Great food and Service!

One of my favorite Thai places, maybe ever.  Fresh, sweet, spicy and all around good.  Not super heavy or cloying sweet.  Friendly service and all at a fair price.  

I hate hearing my neighbors, though.

Called to order for delivery to get my thai fix. Guy on the phone was really friendly. Im only about a mile away from them. Delivery was fast. My food came in like 30mins. Pad thai was ok. Egg rolls has barely anything on it. :( Fried squid, drenched in oil. It sucks that my favorite thai restuarant (Arawan and Thai St. Cafe) are far from where I live. 

2 stars for the service.
1 star for food.

I love this place the pineapple fried rice is delicious we always order for delivery and our experience has been great a good amount of food excellent taste great delivery time thank you guys for providing awesome food this is my to go spot for Thai food cravings awesome

My husband and I were craving Thai food. Unfortunately, we don't have many choices in the North East side of town. We are regulars @ Archis Thai Bistro but since we did not want to drive way across town we decided to give this place a try.

I called and placed an order for take-out... we each ordered Shrimp Pad-Thai, an order of Egg Rolls, Crab Ragoons and Thai Tea. 

I rate the Shrimp Pad-Thai a 3/5 it was pretty bland- my husband enjoyed it but he is not as picky as I am
Egg Rolls 2/5 I can get better ones at Costco 
Crab Ragoons 3/5 
Thai tea 5/5!!!

Literally a hidden gem! I live in Henderson, so it's a bit of a drive, but it's always worth it. The food is above and beyond, absolutely delicious. I've had chicken, curry, seafood, and beef dishes and I've never once been let down. The seafood soup is to die for! This is an awesome little family-run business where you will not be let down!

Ordered food to go from here for our first visit. The staff was nice and kept checking on us ti see if we were ready to order (we took a while to decide). The coconut chicken soup was ok. Horribly sour if you ask me, there has to be better elsewhere. The egg rolls left me wanting better, but they were free so I cannot knock them for these. The rest of our food was great. We ordered fried rice and broccoli and beef for the people not introduced to thai food yet and they loved the flavor. 

The pork red curry we ordered was good; I would order again but will order medium spice. 

The star of the order was the Pad Thai (medium spice). Best flavored Pad Thai I have ever had, definitely good if you are introducing someone to Thai food.

The amount of food we got for the price was decent. We are still eating the leftovers!

...oh yeah almost forgot....Thai Iced Tea is cheap and good here ($2 vs normally $4)! If you have never had it, try it. You won't regret it!

Hmmmm not so much ...




I would rate it 4 or maybe 5 stars but sadly they completely got our order wrong. We asked for no meat pineapple  fried rice and somehow there is egg chicken and shrimp.  I don't mean to be rude but seriously ?  Even though it was wrong the shrimp was overly cooked and the Pad Thai noodles felt like they were just microwaved.  Maybe we happened to order on there bad day but today I am not impressed .

Pros : very fast in delivery & desserts are the best.
First dining at Thai Cuisine was very enjoyable! We ordered the three sauce (?) chicken and spicy basil chicken fried rice - excellent flavors and great portions. Can't wait to try again!

Some of the worst Thai food I've ever had. People need to stop claiming this place is a "hidden gem".

Orderd crab rangoon and some pad thai. The pad thai could have duck added, so I decided to try that instead of the shrimp I normally get in pad thai.

Both dishes came out at the same time, nothing wrong with that, but I went with the appetizer first. The crab rangoon was frozen throughout, no cream cheese, completely filled with imitation crab. The cherry on top being that it had a horrible taste. A combination of extremely old dirty cooking oil and a flavor of the imitation crab being old to the point of spoilage.

The pad thai, while edible, didn't have any real flavor. The duck, tasted more of pork, and was extremely dry, almost to the point of being chewy.

The food is hot garbage. I should have saved my money and went to thai places that have given me consistently awesome food for years: Weerai Thai and Lotus of Siam.

Don't come here, let my bad experience be a sacrificial warning for you.

The BF and I have been here a couple of times, both for lunch. Both times we each had the same thing and each had a great lunch. He gets the eggplant & vegetables, which is very, very good, and I get the (surprise!) pad Thai with chicken. Both come with a little salad with a scrumptious peanut dressing. Even though I know I like the eggplant, and pick out half his vegetables- mmmmm, veggies- I can't order anything but the pad Thai I can't help it. I love it. The only change up in our routine the second time around was we ordered the pork buns. And I cannot tell you what a great move that was! They were seriously better than Noodleheads' buns, and I know that sounds sacrilegious, but they were!  

Service has always been great as well. Now, we are here at lunch, and it has always been slow. I think that's just how it is in Bloomfield at that hour. Either way, everyone is polite and attentive, and the food comes in a very timely fashion. 
All around, I really like this place for our mid-week-bite-for-lunch spot. 

And after you have a great lunch, you can walk down to Paddy Cake Bakery and have a delicious thumbprint cookie. Mmmmmm.....

*For all you alcohol consumers out there, it is BYOB with a cork (ing?) charge of $1.00. or however you say that....

There food is delicious!
This is a dive. 
It is not a place to go in order to dinner in and impress.

This is one of the few places where I tend to get the same dish.
Spicy chili mint chicken lunch is delicious.
Have tried the orange chicken which I did not enjoy.
Had a couple different soups which will fill you up.
I was expecting there kuay jub to be like a pho but it is definitely not. It is very earthy and flavorful with a lot of good bits and pieces.
The wor wonton is very good too.

I've eaten in the restaurant and was looking for some of the same food when I ordered!  I threw the sweet and sour pork away because it looked like it was boiled in slight pink and red food coloring, and was tasteless! the Mongolian beef was boiled in plain water and rubbery!  the only thing halfway edible was the egg roll.  the food there was great when I was in the restaurant ! soups are awesome, presentation was bar none the best with the round soup bowl with a flame in the middle, but I will never order for Home Take out there again!

Ordered  a cat fish soup that had nothing but potatoes and mushroooms.. with a few small little pieces of fish floating around. I'm very disappointed in this place.

Every single time we order something from this place something is off or not good.
Best Thai food I've ever had, customer service is amazing. We will definitely be coming back.
This place is awesome! Great prices, great food. They always remember me and set a plate of spring rolls in front of me as soon as I sit down. Great pad-thai and seafood soup.

This is my local Thai food place. It's not necessarily my favorite, or the best around but here's why I like it:

-It's good. I've liked everything I've ordered.
-It's dependable. Things are consistently good, and I order here fairly often.
-They usually get the spice right (of what you ask for on a scale of 1-10)
- It's better than the other one that is a block away. I don't know what other people have to say about this because I hear conflicting opinions of Thai Cuisine and Thai Gourmet, but I have tried them both and can say that I just like this one more. 

My favorite dish is the green curry. Most veg packed and the tofu option is a great combination (I'm not a veg, but I eat veg often). I really like the way their tofu is steamed, its creamy and delicious in the thin curry sauce. I usually prefer a thicker curry but something about this curry really works as a thin texture - pretty soupy. But it's light and delicious and I am usually drinking it out of the bottom of my bowl like soup. 

I get take-out here quite often, and it is always ready fairly quickly, but I really wish they would deliver so I would not have to move my lazy, hungover ass out of my house. 

The dining experience is OK. BYOB is a great plus, but the interior leaves a lot to be desired. The service is always great. Friendly and accommodating and the manager is always there to greet with a smile.

Very good lunch specials with unlimited egg rolls and soup when you dine in. The soup is always a bit too salty for my liking but the egg rolls are excellent. The other dishes, however, can be hit or miss. Tried the non lunch special beef pad see ew, which tastes pretty much the same no matter where you go, but it was overly greasy and I did not care for it. The service is always awesome though! But it can be a bit slow as they can be short staffed.

I have tried a few of what have been called the best Thai restaurants in this city. But hands down Thai Cuisine checks all the boxes. First, when you order your spice level they do not play, and 8 will be an 8. Full of flavor and hearty portion sizes. Their lunch special is a great deal.

As an expatriate of Pgh, Thai Cuisine was an unexpected gem in the middle of the city.  I have found very little in my current venue of Boston which compares well.

The prices are extremely reasonable, and the seating is intimate. The cuisine is extremely authentic (especially for being Pittsburgh) and is suited from picky eaters to foodies.

The environment is nice, and the lady who always does my takeout is the nicest person ever, but their dishes are hit or miss.

5 stars for their spicy basil fried rice, which is out-of-this-world good.  It's what I order every time I get takeout from here.

Nothing else I've tried here has really wow'ed me.  In particular, the flavor of their duck curry (from the specials menu) is nice but the duck itself was too fatty and very underwhelming, and their rendition of massaman curry is far too watery.

One nice thing about this place is that they do offer gluten-free versions of many dishes!

Read the review on yelp before I decided to pop in. I mean, what kind of name is this restaurant. Thai cuisine??? Straight up thai food, nothing extra like Yai or Jasmine or Lotus. Straight up, thai cuisine. Well, their food was bomb.

Pop in for a nice little lunch snack with my lady and this place is pretty decent for the area. If you think you have to go all the way to chinatown to get a decent thai food. Think again! This place pretty bomb diggity when it comes to thai food. Love their pad thai and their free egg rolls. Did you know that you can get extra soup too if you want. You just have to get it yourself buffet style.
Average Thai food. Not the best but not the worst. If you want Thai food it is worth considering this place!

I am a fan of thai food...  Being asian i have an affinity for food from the far east...  I had the pad thai here...  I ordered it at a 7 in terms on spicyness... I have to say it was a little too strong for my tastes,, kinda killed the other flavors of the dish...  The lady that took the order was very nice... I just ordered the pad thai,, and she threw in an order of Spring Rolls which were tasty.. Not like my mom's or aunt but it was good...  I would recommend the pad thai from here.... I will eat here again for sure... Good solid food, good portions, served with a smile,,, what more could you ask for... Thank you

I've been eating here and getting delivery via Wheel Deliver for years. Discovered it on a fluke when the nearby restaurant we'd planned on dining at had a thirty minute wait. My favorite go-to dish is the Roast Duck Curry entree, with a spice level of four. After reading other reviews I'll have to expand my horizons and try a few other things. On that first visit (since we hadn't planned on eating there) the name of the restaurant never registered with me, so I just started referring to it as 'Bangkok Orgasm'.  Nuf said!

Update 9/6/13: I still love this restaurant and stand by my five stars, but I will not order via Wheel Deliver anymore. I am convinced that although I specify the spice level in my online order that it does not get conveyed to Thai Cuisine by Wheel Deliver. I have had some disappointingly bland orders of roast duck curry, and this has never happened when I have eaten at the restaurant or stopped by for take-out and placed my order in person.

When I first started ordering from this place, delivery was a reasonable time. Now it takes forever. I like this place and my kids do as well. But I'm beginning to wonder if I should find a new place because of the time for delivery.

First time at Thai Cuisine since the revamp.

When I lived in Friendship a decade ago I frequented Thai Cuisine and never had a bad meal there.  When the wife was craving some Thai food I suggested we try my old stomping grounds especially since I noticed it's been remodeled. 

I realized that the place is half the size of the old set up which makes for a better atmosphere.  Everything is still new and clean.  Dark colors and somewhat dim lighting make for an intimate meal even when the bright sun is shining in through the window overlooking Liberty Avenue.

The service was great, almost too attentive.  We had our waters filled every time we took a sip.  Our meals came quickly, almost too quick, making us think too much prep work is done.  The food was really good though.  We each got a bowl of soup.  The wife got the Tom Yum with Shrimp.  It was hot and sour in a good way.  There were three nice sized shrimp in the broth and tasted fresh.  I got the Tom Kha with shrimp, which was excellent.  The coconut broth was smooth and delicious.  I always enjoy this dish and make sure I try it everywhere.  Thai Cuisine balanced this soup very well.  We then shared a massive plate of Pad Thai with veggies and tofu.  The pad thai was good, but not great.  The portion was huge, definitely shareable especially after eating a bowl of soup.  I wasn't impressed however with the amount of veggies in the dish or the amount of sauce.  It lacked both and might get to great with a bit more of each.  Also, the veggies seemed wilted and not really fresh.  

So, in short. Thai Cuisine is a good, but not great Thai option in Pittsburgh.

I ordered delivery food using the Grub Hub app. I had the Spicy Chili Mint Chicken lunch special and the Coconut Thai Ice Cream. Not only was the food delicious, but the delivery was early and my ice cream was perfect! I usually get terrible delivery service in my area, but Thai Cuisine was exceptional! Will definitely be ordering from here again!
We've been coming here for a while the staff is always friendly and the food is delicious. There mangolian beef is so good. Love there rice and chow mein

I never want this place to close. It is a spot that makes my mouth water and my belly rumble. I love to find reasons to go, like I need a better reason than, dang this is good food. I love that the decor has really transformed since the remodel years ago but the food has stayed the same. I honestly love it. It is hard to just pick one thing on the menu that I love because, honestly it is all so freaking good. This trip we came because I had a friend visiting from California and was craving Thai food. Of course this was the spot that we recommended. IT is so close to my house that I come more often than I should. 

Starters:

Thai Spring Rolls (fried): Fried spring rolls stuffed with vegetables, glass noodles. Served with plum sauce. I mean their fried springs rolls are fantastic. I think that they were 2 in the order so if you are looking to feed a group it would be a good idea to pick more from the menu. Filling but I could eat the order of two myself, and I am not that big of a sharer. 

Thai Cuisine Rolls (fresh): Fresh rice paper stuffed with lettuce, basil leaves, and vermicelli noodles. Served with Thai Cuisine special house sauce. These were also good. We added tofu to the rolls. They also come with only two rolls but are a bit bulkier so they are more sustainable for an appetizer.

We asked for these rolls to be cut in half to help us divide them up more evenly with the group. This worked out nicely for all of us. 

Fried tofu (personal favorite/fried): Crispy fried tofu. Served with a peanut sauce. Personal favorite. I love fried tofu and Thai Cuisine does a really good job. Not to crispy and not too much breading. Just the right amount of fried to make you want to come back for more but not worry about the calories. 

Main Dish:

Panang Curry: Broccoli, bell peppers, and basil leaves in a coconut curry sauce. Heck yes. This is what I get all the time. I add extra veggies and chicken to mine to make it a more filling dish. I love the sauce and could drink it if that wasn't super weird or possibly give me a bad belly ache. The veggies are always crisp and tasty. I like that you also get a choice for brown or white rice. I usually like brown but sometimes will mix it up if I am feeling peckish. I would suggest a nice even spice level of 3. I do not like to not be able to enjoy what I am eating so a level 3 is just up my alley.

I love it here. I think that more people should try it out. They are also BYOB so we enjoyed a nice bottle of wine for a glass fee that was really reasonable. They even brought us out a nice bucket of ice to chill the wine in. 

The service and the staff were excellent. The food is top notch. Come here for a nice dinner and great conversation. It really is something else.
My usual try at a Thai restaurant is chicken fried rice and it was good.keep the spice level less than 6 as it was hot at 7.
Love this good when I was pregnant with my daughter I ate almost every day . They are always friendly and have offers and coupons they always offer me and my family

Food isn't bad. The server was  unfriendly and uninterested.  We asked for Chilli sauce at the beginning of the meal.  He didn't bring it. We reminded him later after the food was brought. He took his own time.  As for the food, it's nothing special.  There are many Thai restaurants in pittsburgh that do better, and with friendlier staff.

Like other reviewers have said, this place is very basic but the service is fast and friendly and the food was amazing. The vegetarian Tom Yum soup was perfect! We ordered the special of the day - a fried trout dish which was incredible. The price was very reasonable too. The six year old in our party (who doesn't like spicy food) loved the fried dumpling which was recommended by our server and one of the house specialties - three flavored chicken. We ordered the banana springroll for desert - also tasty. Don't expect a fancy place but if you want really good and fast thai food, this is the place to go in Pittsburgh.
As good as it gets. They know how to make it spicy AND flavorfull!

I'm honestly really torn on this review, I don't know if I should do 2 or 3 stars, so I'm going to go with 2. 

My husband and I have been craving good Thai food for a while, and we broke down on Saturday and ordered some from Thai Cuisine, after looking at their overall rating. 

We tried to order online, but were told that they didn't deliver to our area.  

I called, and the lady was super nice, stating that they would deliver to us.   
We ordered a Yellow curry, Panag curry, and the 10 piece egg roll appetizer.  

When the driver arrived, he wasn't carrying any change for us to give him less than a $10 tip.  That wasn't happening, so we were forced to give him a smaller tip than we had planned on, had he had change.  

So...the curries looked REALLY greasy when they arrived.  
After stirring them a bit, they were less so, but that was kind of disheartening.  

The curries were also very thin.  Almost watery.  
The yellow curry was really tasty though.  Flavorful, and there was plenty of food in the container.,

The panang, however, was a huge disappointment.  
We ordered the yellow curry at a level 3 spicy, and it was about a 3.  Spicy, but not overwhelming.  (For me...I can't do spicy.  My husband loves it.)
The panang we ordered at a level 4.  It was more like a 7.  Spicy for the sake of spicy.  No flavor.  there was more liquid in the container than beef and veggies.  SUPER disappointing.  Even my husband said it was too spicy.  

And they only sent 2 TINY containers of rice.  And I mean TINY.  When you have that much curry, with THAT much liquid/juice, I'm sorry, but you really need to send at least one big container and one small...not happy about the fact that we have to go buy rice in order to eat our leftovers.  

the egg rolls were ok.  They're the little spring rolls, not actual egg rolls, and they had a bit too much breading/wrapper...bu the veggies inside were crisp,which was nice.  

So, at this point, we aren't super impressed.  
We will probably order from here again, because its close, but we'll definitely have lower expectations.

Elsewhere, I have bemoaned the standardization of Thai food (at least outside of NYC. NYC seems to be in the midst of a love affair with regional Thai cuisine which is exciting). When I heard that this restaurant was called simply Thai Cuisine, I was expecting more bland pad thai, more limp pad see ew. 

What we got, though, well exceeded my expectations. The Viking shrimp was particularly good - a hot pot with glass noodles, prawns, carrots, onions, tons of cilantro, and quite a punch of spice (the waiter asked us how spicy we wanted the food on a scale of 1 to 10. We said 4, and I'm glad we didn't say 5 or 6 because 4 was lip burning).  The ginger root chicken, normally a hot bed of blandness was also surprisingly tasty - tons of fresh bell peppers and celery, and chicken in a delicious salty and sweet black bean sauce.  

Extra points here for a gracious and friendly waitstaff, and for Pittsburgh prices - dinner for two was $27 and we have enough left over for at least one extra meal.

Food it's delicious service it's awesome I have try many items in their Menu but my favorites are papaya salad on a #4 which it's not to spicy  and yellow shrimp curry #6 perfect combination and to drink THAI tea ASK for PAM she it's a great server ;)

I had to order a dinner for about 15 physicians to be delivered between 5-515p.  While Thai Cuisine is closed between 2:30-5, their service was impeccable.  

I called Thai Cuisine around 11:30 am to figure out if/how they could do our order.  I wanted to see if they could even have our food at 5.  The gentleman I spoke with was awesome.  Let me know that while they didn't deliver, grub hub did.  He also let me know  - they could take our order over the phone so they could start - or I could submit it on grubhub with the 5p delivery request.

I asked which was easier for them as I truly did appreciate all their help.  THe order was placed via grubhub. ( I will tell you the grubhub part of the experience was terrible (delivery driver in the lobby of the hospital saying rude things about other races, phone didn't work and said our delivery was delivered 10 minutes before we received it).  But this isn't a review on grubhub!)

Thai Cuisine beautifully labeled very container so I knew who got what food.  They sent forks, plates, extra sauce and chopsticks.  Everything was perfect. I couldn't have asked for an easier order.  

Every.single.physician raved about their food.  Every drop was eaten.  It was delicious!  Not a single complaint.  I don't have any eating in the restaurant experience, but to go orders are amazing and will certainly happen again!  Thank you Thai Cuisine for being so helpful and accomodating!

I think Pittsburgh is a little weird. Restaurants and places close at odd times and therefore my friend and I were stranded on Liberty Ave looking for a decent restaurant that was open. We gave up and decided to go for some Thai. It's a very nice place and I was very happy with the fact that our waiter was friendly. I always like polite and friendly servers. I ordered the hot and sour soup which I gobbled up right away. It was delicious and super hot, just how I like it. I ordered one of the Pad Thai's I don't quite recall which one exactly but I thought it was very yummy. I enjoyed the fact that they give you a scale of spiciness from 1-10 to choose from. Usually at restaurants people just ask if you want it mild or spicy, but this gives people a nice range to choose from. My friend got one of the curry dishes they had and it was really good as well. After a night of searching for food, I'm glad I ended up with a satisfying meal.

This thai place was....ok.

I got the mango curry dish. I mean, it was okay? Wasn't anything special though.... he got the basil fried rice...and he sure enjoyed it...

I think I've definitely tried better thai food though. It's your typical restaurant- but..... I wish there was some kick to it, or some.... more originality? It was just okay.....

Service was superb though. The waiter was constantly around to fill out water glasses. A+ for the service, for sure!

I finally sat down in here to have a meal instead of ordering take out or having it delivered. I went on lunch time. And it was a pretty good special. You must get the egg rolls and soup yourself. The Thai Iced tea was delicious. The lunch portion of Ginger chicken was great and filling. The Ginger wasnt over powering. Kudos on the seasoning being spot on.

Awesome Thai take out! A bit expensive, but the quality is excellent. Both curries we tried were great - panang with beef and green with tofu - I'd recommend both! Like other Thai restaurants, you pick your spice level. At a 6 mine was doable and I could have gone a bit hotter because I like the heat. We also tried the crab Rangoon which was a hit. Since we got take out, we didn't experience sitting down - but the interior is very nice and welcoming. I will return!

VERY GOOD!!!, I ordered:
Seafood tom yum (Soup)
Green chicken curry (medium)
Papaya salad (medium)
Crispy squid
Tasted great, would definitely recommend this place.

Only thing missing on the order menu is, STICKY RICE.
Can you please put it on the menu.
This is our go to place. The best pad thai I have ever had. Great prices, fast delivery, and excellent menu. This place rocks!!

Pros:
Huge Portions!
I went alone as I was craving Thai and hubby was not. The service was quick, I didnt have to wait long for my food and, as previously noted, ginormous portions! I served myself twice and still took home a full to-go box! I had the broccili chicken, so good! Oh and great Thai tea!
Cons: The waitress could have been more pleasant and the chicken was not fried, it was just boiled and I could tell.

Food's great don't get me wrong. 

Customer service is a bit awful. 

Ordered an orange chicken lunch special and tasted different, worse. I went to the restaurant and asked why it tasted bad, they said they had a new cook the day i ordered. Now their chef is back. I asked for a replacement lunch special. Declined my request. 

Eat at your own risk.

After being deprived of Thai food for 2 years, and before that coming from the land of abundance in NYC and also SE Asia- I know good Thai food, and was excited to start my exploration of the Thai food scene in Pittsburgh (am I way too optimistic?!).

First attempt: Thai Cuisine.  It ain't so terrible.  The chicken pad thai was respectable.  The penang curry didn't quite have the rich peanut and coconut flavor I was craving, but the base curry flavors lingered in the background, which gives me hope.  

Heck for $23 I'm willing to go there again.  Sad that they don't have curry puffs, but it's a great location, the people are friendly, and you can get delivery.   

I'm still on my quest, but this certainly is a solid option when the craving for Thai hits.

Came here for lunch on a weekday with the bf and during our meal, I noticed it started to get really crowded, which meant this place is a go to spot for Thai food. The lunch prices here are very affordable and the service was friendly. The fried wonton pieces they gave us before our meal was sort of stale though. Anyway, I got the pad see ew and it was okay, borderline pretty good. It wasn't as flavorful as I hoped it would be compared to the other Thai restaurants I've been to, but again, it was still good, just not memorable. You also get a good amount of food too for the lunch specials. We ended our meal with the mango & sweet rice dessert and it was tasty. The rice was cooked perfectly and the mango was ripe and sweet. Overall the food was good (A-ok), but I sort of feel like I've had more flavorful Thai food at other restaurants. But I can see why people come here for a quick and affordable lunch especially if you are craving Thai food.
One of my favorite Thai restaurants in Pittsburgh. Love the spicy basil noodles! Can't wait to return.

Best Thai food in town, for sure.  Screw all those other places, they're inferior and probably cost way more.

The green curry is my favorite thing, but the yellow curry is pretty good.  There are vegetarian options (although I usually go for the meat), and one time they had a salmon tom kha gai soup special, which I wasn't sure was a good idea, but it was actually a terrific idea.

One of the few places I can take any or all of my family or in-laws and be sure that everyone will enjoy themself.

The name kind of lends itself to semi-comedic confusion, though:
"Where do you want to go for dinner?"
"How about Thai Cuisine?"
"Thai sounds great.  Where do you want to go?"
"Um... Thai Cuisine?"
(Wash, rinse, repeat...)

Pretty good and decently priced for a Thai place. I was sick when I went there (the ginger tea helped me quite a bit). The wait staff was very friendly and came over to ask if we needed anything on a regular basis even though it was close to 10pm.

Spicy noodles were great. We also ordered the lychee curry, which I thought was ok, but nothing too spectacular. All in all a good place for decent thai food in pittsburgh.

I love this restaurant! I do think it's the best Thai place in town. The curry is amazing and i love the appetizers. Anything I've ever gotten here is great. The service is also very good and the staff is always friendly.

Brought a large group of students here for a field trip, they were very accommodating for a large group at the last minute. It was an easy location for us down the street from the school at bonanza and nellis.  If you aren't in this location I would not go out of my way to come here, however if you are in the area this is a good, quick and affordable place to grab thai food. 

The interior is nothing special, the typical thai interior with pictures of elephants and Buddha. The staff is very friendly and brought it's free egg rolls,  extra fried bananas for our group and just overall made us feel welcome, and taken care of. 

We  really enjoyed our experience here, some of them had food that was not so impressive,  I had the pad see ew and that was good, but not the best I ever had. In the future I would probably go somewhere else for other thai food but for pad see ew it was fine.
Excellent Thai food. The red curry, crab fried rice and Pad Thai were very good as was the seafood soup.  Service was awesome!

DON'T JUDGE A BOOK BY IT'S COVER.

A hidden gem, this place is phenomenal - best Thai food I've ever had. You need to go here.

Very good Thai food. I enjoyed the Spicy Beef Salad, Chili Mint Noodles, and the Tom Kah Gai soup. All were very good. I don't know why there are Chinese items on the menu. We did receive free spring rolls for our table, which was nice. I do wish they had the cold, fresh spring rolls on the menu. The staff was very, very friendly and I ate here three times during a two week business trip!

Loved this place! I am a big fan of "Thai Me Up" in the Southside for their Spicy Basil Noodles (not much else unfortunately), but this place is my new favorite!  Super fast service and really great flavors in the Spicy Basil Dish!  I was hesitant to try it since I didn't think that I'd like their twist, adding green peppers and onions, but now they have set the bar!  This is the way the dish should be prepared!  Such a great surprise!  Their pad thai was good too, but I'd recommend the spicy basil dish first and foremost.
Chicken Panang is always hot & fresh! Excellent sauce with great balance of spice & coconut

Ive been coming to this place over 10 years!!great staff and owner. They have always taken care of me every visit. Cool spot to check out if you're in this part of town. Thai teas, curry, pad thai!! Its all great!! They always give you free egg rolls with every order.
The food is delicious here! And they have some of the friendliest people you'll ever meet. It is definitely one of our favorites!

Thai Cuisine changed us. My dining companion and I like to explore a menu, trying a bunch of different things. Yet, we both repeated our original orders (Pumpkin Green Curry for me and Spicy Noodles for him) on the second trip. We always share our meals so we get to try two instead of one. Yet, neither of us let the other have a single bite, or even asked for one. 

With a fun waitstaff, no reservations needed, under $20 per person meals, BYO, and, consistently good food, we will return. Maybe next time we will explore and share... But I wouldn't count on it...

Thai Cuisine has got to be  one of the best Thai restaurants I've ever been to. Definitely comparable to the quality you'd expect at restaurants in major cities like NYC or Chicago.
The fried Thai spring rolls are so super good and in my top five for appetizers. Stuffed with veggies and glass noodles.
Pad Thai with chicken or beef are amongst my regular orders. But I also love the Thai steak and spicy noodles with beef (level 8).
And the green tea cheesecake, holy heck you guys...amazeballs!!

I've ordered from here quite a few times. The prices are very good for the amount of food that they will stuff in each box. The food always tastes great with one time being an exception. The delivery is usually very quick.
To start off, the best things about this place is the cleanliness and friendliness of the staff, and the incredibly affordable lunch special.  However, the food is nothing spectacular.

Yum this is one of my favorite Thai places on the east side! It's pretty much the only one. The food is super authentic and they always give you veggie egg rolls with whatever you order! The Pad Thai is fantastic. I suggest the Shrimp or vegetable Pad Thai. They have vegetarian options which I really enjoy! I suggest this place to anyone on the east side who wants real authentic good Thai food from a nice friendly staff!

I love Thai food and the food here is fantastic! 

There are lots of great Thai restaurants in Pittsburgh, but this is definitely one of my favorites. There are not may places that make great pad thai and great red curry, but this place does. 

Service is always good and the food comes out well prepared and quickly. I keep wanting to try something new, but the old standbys are so good that I haven't really veered away from them.

My Thai food world tour took a detour to nowhere for a while... but I'm back on! And what a triumphant return it was!! 

I had wanted to try Thai Cuisine for a while but was held up by their remodel. Since I wasn't in before, I can't compare to the old, but I'm digging the new look! It's fresh and vibrant, with a friendly staff and comfy booths. They're winning with me already...

We were seated quickly, and almost as our butts hit the booth, there was a bowl of fried noodles and sweet n' sour sauce dropped off like lightning! Bonus points! Being totally committed to trying Pad Thai at every Thai place in the Burgh, you know what I ordered. Okay, you really want to know? Pad Thai with shrimp.

So here's the thing. I really liked the Pad Thai noodles and sauce. It was a huge portion that I ate entirely (lay off me, I'm starving!!) and it was very saucy (just the way I like it!). I was not into the shrimp. It tasted fishy. Like suspicious fishy. I couldn't put my finger on it. Was it unfrozen recently? Did it have freezer burn? Was it sitting out too long? I couldn't tell. But the one thing I knew was that it was not fresh. Bummer. It also came with this weird side salad on the plate. It was had a really thick, almost disgustingly so, peanut dressing with a touch of iceberg lettuce. I took a couple bites and gave up. Methinks not!

So mental note, next time don't order the shrimp. But seriously, this was the closest I've had to my favorite Pad Thai in the city, Spice Island in Oakland. I promise you, I'll order something different next time I go back!!

The place is nice but was not to happy with the pad Thai but beef and broccoli was awesome orange chicken was ok not that great had them  Exchange my pad Thai and they did great customer service was happy with the place not sure if I would go again but try it
Found this place about a month ago and have ordered delivery four times already. Love the pad see ew and sweet & sour pork.
Great Thai food at a great price! Incredibly friendly service and super fast to get an order out. Would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone in the North Las Vegas area!

This is another one of the great Thai places that Pittsburgh has to offer.  I've been here a few times, and I know I'll keep coming back.  I usually get the Pad Se Ew, and it has a good amount of veggies and chicken.  My favorite here has to be the dessert - Mango Sticky Rice, which very simple, but very tasty (and refreshing in the summer).  I haven't tried the curries, but after reading the other reviews it is next on my list.  The decor is more 'professional' than Spice Island and its generally  quieter, so its easier to chat in a larger group.

I'm going to start off with this tip - I don't recommend the fresh spring rolls. They are, by far, the worst fresh spring rolls I've ever had. No mint. no basil. The tiniest amount of glass noodles. Made with iceberg lettuce? Never have I ever had a spring roll where the base was iceberg lettuce. This was extremely disappointing. 
I ordered the panang curry dish and was pleasantly surprised by the flavor, but not by the tiny dish of rice that accompanied it. The rice to curry ratio was off, big time. Next we ordered the pad thai... I'm still curious as to why the noodles were orange. Bright orange. Despite the color, the dish was fair. 
Unfortunately, I wouldn't come back. I'd go down the street to Thai gourmet where the fresh spring rolls are full of flavor and the pad Thai is not orange.

I feel like I start so many reviews by saying "this if my fave spot in Pittsburgh", but I swear on our 6 Super Bowl championships that Thai Cuisine is my absolute favorite place in this city! So much so that I have to limit myself to a weekly trip, cause if I had unlimited money, I'd eat here every day.

Their vegan/veg options are plentiful, and the staff are super-knowledgeable about all the ingredients in their food and how items are prepared. You can rest-assured if you have any sort of dietary restriction or allergy, Thai Cuisine will happily accommodate you. They are also BYOB will a nominal fee. I recommend popping across the street to Caliente to pick-up beer if you forget to plan ahead!

My go-to dish is the Three Flavored Tofu with brown rice. Tofu is not an easy thing to cook, and there is nothing worse than mushy tofu. I can promise that the tofu from Thai Cuisine is fried to a crispy, golden perfection. Even your most carnivorous friends would find this dish delightful.

Never change, Thai Cuisine.

Gross! When we walked in we could sit where ever, so we picked a booth. As we walk over you notice there are tables littered with dishes, cups, food. The floor looks as if it hasn't been swept all day....get to our booth....there are egg rolls and food on the floor below us. The wall, blinds, fake plants were dusty and looked like soda was spilled on the wall. At this time I'm ready to run but the boyfriend insisted the food was soooo good and worth the gross surroundings. Then the waiting game began....wait....wait....wait....oh hello waitress. Order drinks and place our order for food at the same time. She walks off and I'm watching her she obviously became distracted with other duties. We got our drinks when we got our food. It was ok nothing spectacular and I will not be back. Took the BF to a BETTER, CLEANER Thai Spot and now he knows this place is crap.
Ordered the Pad See Ew. This place doesn't measure up to Noodle Head's Pad See Ew. The Pad Ka Prao was also quite bland. The Tom Yum soup leans on the sweeter side. We enjoyed the egg rolls.
Food is amazing! I always end up spending close to $100 with getting so much stuff. There lunch specials are amazing and the Pad-ti is the best!
The food is good, specially their Seafood Soup. They always give great customer service too.
I have been going here for years. This place is still good. They even deliver and the food shows up like it just got done (not soggy). The staff is always courteous and polite!

With the not-so-recent closing of Sweet Basil still looming in my mind, I have yet to find a new thai food home.  I headed to Thai Cuisine with high hopes and several positive reviews from friends.

The service was good, decor so-so, and prices were great.  In fact, I double-checked the bill because I thought the waitress may have forgotten to add an entree, it was that reasonably priced!  

The food was good, solid thai food.  My mind wasn't blown, nor was I disappointed.  I think all thai restaurants need to unite and decide on a single "heat scale" to rule them all.  Some places it's 1-5, some 1-10, and I've even seen a 1-7 thrown in here and there.  The problem is, they are all subjective to the cook.

I ordered a 7 out of 10 and got back something milder than mild buffalo wing hot.  I think I ruined the food a little by adding my own mix of chilis.  My wife loved her curry, and my pad thai wasn't bad.  I'd go back, but the search continues...
